BitField.name: ETV
BitField.description: Endianness test value The endianness test value is 0x8765 4321.

Register.name: FDCAN_DBTP
Register.description: FDCAN data bit timing and prescaler register

BitField.name: DSJW
BitField.description: Synchronization jump width Must always be smaller than DTSEG2, valid values are 0 to 15. The value used by the hardware is the one programmed, incremented by 1: tSJW = (DSJW + 1) x tq.

BitField.name: DTSEG2
BitField.description: Data time segment after sample point Valid values are 0 to 15. The value used by the hardware is the one programmed, incremented by 1, i.e. tBS2 = (DTSEG2 + 1) x tq.

BitField.name: DTSEG1
BitField.description: Data time segment before sample point Valid values are 0 to 31. The value used by the hardware is the one programmed, incremented by 1, i.e. tBS1 = (DTSEG1 + 1) x tq.

BitField.name: DBRP
BitField.description: Data bit rate prescaler The value by which the oscillator frequency is divided to generate the bit time quanta. The bit time is built up from a multiple of this quanta. Valid values for the Baud Rate Prescaler are 0 to 31. The hardware interpreters this value as the value programmed plus 1.

BitField.name: TDC
BitField.description: Transceiver delay compensation

BitField.name: LBCK
BitField.description: Loop back mode

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Reset value, Loop Back mode is disabled

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Loop Back mode is enabled (see Power down (Sleep mode))

BitField.name: TX
BitField.description: Control of transmit pin

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Reset value, FDCANx_TX TX is controlled by the CAN core, updated at the end of the CAN bit time

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Sample point can be monitored at pin FDCANx_TX

BitField.name: RX
BitField.description: Receive pin Monitors the actual value of pin FDCANx_RX

BitField.name: WDC
BitField.description: Watchdog configuration Start value of the message RAM watchdog counter. With the reset value of 00, the counter is disabled. These are protected write (P) bits, write access is possible only when the bit 1 [CCE] and bit 0 [INIT] of FDCAN_CCCR register are set to 1.

BitField.name: WDV
BitField.description: Watchdog value Actual message RAM watchdog counter value.

BitField.name: CCE
BitField.description: Configuration change enable

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The CPU has no write access to the protected configuration registers.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The CPU has write access to the protected configuration registers (while CCCR.INIT = 1).

BitField.name: ASM
BitField.description: ASM restricted operation mode The restricted operation mode is intended for applications that adapt themselves to different CAN bit rates. The application tests different bit rates and leaves the Restricted Operation Mode after it has received a valid frame. In the optional Restricted Operation Mode the node is able to transmit and receive data and remote frames and it gives acknowledge to valid frames, but it does not send active error frames or overload frames. In case of an error condition or overload condition, it does not send dominant bits, instead it waits for the occurrence of bus idle condition to resynchronize itself to the CAN communication. The error counters are not incremented. Bit ASM can only be set by software when both CCE and INIT are set to 1. The bit can be reset by the software at any time.

BitField.name: CSA
BitField.description: Clock stop acknowledge

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: FDCAN may be set in power down by stopping APB clock and kernel clock.

BitField.name: CSR
BitField.description: Clock stop request

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Clock stop requested. When clock stop is requested, first INIT and then CSA is set after all pending transfer requests have been completed and the CAN bus reached idle.

BitField.name: MON
BitField.description: Bus monitoring mode Bit MON can only be set by software when both CCE and INIT are set to 1. The bit can be reset by the Host at any time.

BitField.name: DAR
BitField.description: Disable automatic retransmission

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Automatic retransmission of messages not transmitted successfully enabled

BitField.name: TEST
BitField.description: Test mode enable

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Normal operation, register TEST holds reset values

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Test Mode, write access to register TEST enabled

BitField.name: FDOE
BitField.description: FD operation enable

BitField.name: BRSE
BitField.description: FDCAN bit rate switching

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Bit rate switching for transmissions disabled

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Bit rate switching for transmissions enabled

BitField.name: PXHD
BitField.description: Protocol exception handling disable

BitField.name: EFBI
BitField.description: Edge filtering during bus integration

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Two consecutive dominant tq required to detect an edge for hard synchronization

BitField.name: TXP
BitField.description: If this bit is set, the FDCAN pauses for two CAN bit times before starting the next transmission after successfully transmitting a frame.

BitField.name: NISO
BitField.description: Non ISO operation If this bit is set, the FDCAN uses the CAN FD frame format as specified by the Bosch CAN FD Specification V1.0.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: CAN FD frame format according to ISO11898-1

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: CAN FD frame format according to Bosch CAN FD Specification V1.0

Register.name: FDCAN_NBTP
Register.description: FDCAN nominal bit timing and prescaler register

BitField.name: NTSEG2
BitField.description: Nominal time segment after sample point Valid values are 0 to 127. The actual interpretation by the hardware of this value is such that one more than the programmed value is used.

BitField.name: NTSEG1
BitField.description: Nominal time segment before sample point Valid values are 0 to 255. The actual interpretation by the hardware of this value is such that one more than the programmed value is used. These are protected write (P) bits, write access is possible only when the bit 1 [CCE] and bit 0 [INIT] of CCCR register are set to 1.

BitField.name: NBRP
BitField.description: Bit rate prescaler Value by which the oscillator frequency is divided for generating the bit time quanta. The bit time is built up from a multiple of this quanta. Valid values are 0 to 511. The actual interpretation by the hardware of this value is such that one more than the value programmed here is used. These are protected write (P) bits, write access is possible only when the bit 1 [CCE] and bit 0 [INIT] of CCCR register are set to 1.

BitField.name: NSJW
BitField.description: Nominal (re)synchronization jump width Valid values are 0 to 127. The actual interpretation by the hardware of this value is such that the used value is the one programmed incremented by one. These are protected write (P) bits, write access is possible only when the bit 1 [CCE] and bit 0 [INIT] of CCCR register are set to 1.

BitField.name: TSS
BitField.description: Timestamp select These are protected write (P) bits, write access is possible only when the bit 1 [CCE] and bit 0 [INIT] of CCCR register are set to 1.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Timestamp counter value incremented according to TCP

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: External timestamp counter from TIM3 value (tim3_cnt[0:15])

BitField.name: TCP
BitField.description: Timestamp counter prescaler Configures the timestamp and timeout counters time unit in multiples of CAN bit times [1 â¦ 16]. The actual interpretation by the hardware of this value is such that one more than the value programmed here is used. In CAN FD mode the internal timestamp counter TCP does not provide a constant time base due to the different CAN bit times between arbitration phase and data phase. Thus CAN FD requires an external counter for timestamp generation (TSS = 10). These are protected write (P) bits, write access is possible only when the bit 1 [CCE] and bit 0 [INIT] of CCCR register are set to 1.

BitField.name: TSC
BitField.description: Timestamp counter The internal/external timestamp counter value is captured on start of frame (both Rx and Tx). When TSCC[TSS] = 01, the timestamp counter is incremented in multiples of CAN bit times [1 â¦ 16] depending on the configuration of TSCC[TCP]. A wrap around sets interrupt flag IR[TSW]. Write access resets the counter to 0. When TSCC.TSS = 10, TSC reflects the external timestamp counter value. A write access has no impact.

BitField.name: ETOC
BitField.description: Timeout counter enable This is a protected write (P) bit, write access is possible only when the bit 1 [CCE] and bit 0 [INIT] of CCCR register are set to 1.

BitField.name: TOS
BitField.description: Timeout select When operating in Continuous mode, a write to TOCV presets the counter to the value configured by TOCC[TOP] and continues down-counting. When the timeout counter is controlled by one of the FIFOs, an empty FIFO presets the counter to the value configured by TOCC[TOP]. Down-counting is started when the first FIFO element is stored. These are protected write (P) bits, write access is possible only when the bit 1 [CCE] and bit 0 [INIT] of CCCR register are set to 1.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Timeout controlled by Tx Event FIFO

BitField.name: TOP
BitField.description: Timeout period Start value of the timeout counter (down-counter). Configures the timeout period.

BitField.name: TOC
BitField.description: Timeout counter The timeout counter is decremented in multiples of CAN bit times [1 â¦ 16] depending on the configuration of TSCC.TCP. When decremented to 0, interrupt flag IR.TOO is set and the Timeout Counter is stopped. Start and reset/restart conditions are configured via TOCC.TOS.

BitField.name: TEC
BitField.description: Transmit error counter Actual state of the transmit error counter, values between 0 and 255. When CCCR.ASM is set, the CAN protocol controller does not increment TEC and REC when a CAN protocol error is detected, but CEL is still incremented.

BitField.name: REC
BitField.description: Receive error counter Actual state of the receive error counter, values between 0 and 127.

BitField.name: RP
BitField.description: Receive error passive

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The receive error counter is below the error passive level of 128.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The receive error counter has reached the error passive level of 128.

BitField.name: CEL
BitField.description: CAN error logging The counter is incremented each time when a CAN protocol error causes the transmit error counter or the receive error counter to be incremented. It is reset by read access to CEL. The counter stops at 0xFF; the next increment of TEC or REC sets interrupt flag IR[ELO]. Access type is RX: reset on read.

BitField.name: LEC
BitField.description: Last error code The LEC indicates the type of the last error to occur on the CAN bus. This field is cleared to 0 when a message has been transferred (reception or transmission) without error. Access type is RS: set on read.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: No Error: No error occurred since LEC has been reset by successful reception or transmission.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Stuff Error: More than 5 equal bits in a sequence have occurred in a part of a received message where this is not allowed.

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: Form Error: A fixed format part of a received frame has the wrong format.

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: AckError: The message transmitted by the FDCAN was not acknowledged by another node.

Enum.name: B_0x4
Enum.description: Bit1Error: During the transmission of a message (with the exception of the arbitration field), the device wanted to send a recessive level (bit of logical value 1), but the monitored bus value was dominant.

Enum.name: B_0x5
Enum.description: Bit0Error: During the transmission of a message (or acknowledge bit, or active error flag, or overload flag), the device wanted to send a dominant level (data or identifier bit logical value 0), but the monitored bus value was recessive. During Bus_Off recovery this status is set each time a sequence of 11 recessive bits has been monitored. This enables the CPU to monitor the proceeding of the Bus_Off recovery sequence (indicating the bus is not stuck at dominant or continuously disturbed).

Enum.name: B_0x6
Enum.description: CRCError: The CRC check sum of a received message was incorrect. The CRC of an incoming message does not match with the CRC calculated from the received data.

Enum.name: B_0x7
Enum.description: NoChange: Any read access to the Protocol status register re-initializes the LEC to '7â. When the LEC shows the value '7â, no CAN bus event was detected since the last CPU read access to the Protocol status register.

BitField.name: ACT
BitField.description: Activity Monitors the moduleâs CAN communication state.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Synchronizing: node is synchronizing on CAN communication.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Idle: node is neither receiver nor transmitter.

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: Receiver: node is operating as receiver.

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: Transmitter: node is operating as transmitter.

BitField.name: EP
BitField.description: Error passive

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The FDCAN is in the Error_Active state. It normally takes part in bus communication and sends an active error flag when an error has been detected.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The FDCAN is in the Error_Passive state.

BitField.name: EW
BitField.description: Warning Sstatus

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Both error counters are below the Error_Warning limit of 96.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: At least one of error counter has reached the Error_Warning limit of 96.

BitField.name: BO
BitField.description: Bus_Off status

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The FDCAN is in Bus_Off state.

BitField.name: DLEC
BitField.description: Data last error code Type of last error that occurred in the data phase of a FDCAN format frame with its BRS flag set. Coding is the same as for LEC. This field is cleared to 0 when a FDCAN format frame with its BRS flag set has been transferred (reception or transmission) without error. Access type is RS: set on read.

BitField.name: RESI
BitField.description: ESI flag of last received FDCAN message This bit is set together with REDL, independent of acceptance filtering. Access type is RX: reset on read.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Last received FDCAN message did not have its ESI flag set.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Last received FDCAN message had its ESI flag set.

BitField.name: RBRS
BitField.description: BRS flag of last received FDCAN message This bit is set together with REDL, independent of acceptance filtering. Access type is RX: reset on read.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Last received FDCAN message did not have its BRS flag set.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Last received FDCAN message had its BRS flag set.

BitField.name: REDL
BitField.description: Received FDCAN message This bit is set independent of acceptance filtering. Access type is RX: reset on read.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Since this bit was reset by the CPU, no FDCAN message has been received.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Message in FDCAN format with EDL flag set has been received.

BitField.name: PXE
BitField.description: Protocol exception event

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: No protocol exception event occurred since last read access

BitField.name: TDCV
BitField.description: Transmitter delay compensation value Position of the secondary sample point, defined by the sum of the measured delay from FDCAN_TX to FDCAN_RX and TDCR.TDCO. The SSP position is, in the data phase, the number of minimum time quanta (mtq) between the start of the transmitted bit and the secondary sample point. Valid values are 0 to 127 mtq.

BitField.name: TDCF
BitField.description: Transmitter delay compensation filter window length Defines the minimum value for the SSP position, dominant edges on FDCAN_RX that would result in an earlier SSP position are ignored for transmitter delay measurements. These are protected write (P) bits, which means that write access by the bits is possible only when the bit 1 [CCE] and bit 0 [INIT] of CCCR register are set to 1.

BitField.name: TDCO
BitField.description: Transmitter delay compensation offset Offset value defining the distance between the measured delay from FDCAN_TX to FDCAN_RX and the secondary sample point. Valid values are 0 to 127 mtq. These are protected write (P) bits, which means that write access by the bits is possible only when the bit 1 [CCE] and bit 0 [INIT] of CCCR register are set to 1.

BitField.name: RF0N
BitField.description: Rx FIFO 0 new message

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: No new message written to Rx FIFO 0

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: New message written to Rx FIFO 0

BitField.name: RF0F
BitField.description: Rx FIFO 0 full

BitField.name: RF0L
BitField.description: Rx FIFO 0 message lost

BitField.name: RF1N
BitField.description: Rx FIFO 1 new message

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: No new message written to Rx FIFO 1

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: New message written to Rx FIFO 1

BitField.name: RF1F
BitField.description: Rx FIFO 1 full

BitField.name: RF1L
BitField.description: Rx FIFO 1 message lost

BitField.name: HPM
BitField.description: High-priority message

BitField.name: TC
BitField.description: Transmission completed

BitField.name: TCF
BitField.description: Transmission cancellation finished

BitField.name: TFE
BitField.description: Tx FIFO empty

BitField.name: TEFN
BitField.description: Tx event FIFO New Entry

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Tx handler wrote Tx event FIFO element.

BitField.name: TEFF
BitField.description: Tx event FIFO full

BitField.name: TEFL
BitField.description: Tx event FIFO element lost

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: No Tx event FIFO element lost

BitField.name: TSW
BitField.description: Timestamp wraparound

BitField.name: MRAF
BitField.description: Message RAM access failure The flag is set when the Rx handler: has not completed acceptance filtering or storage of an accepted message until the arbitration field of the following message has been received. In this case acceptance filtering or message storage is aborted and the Rx Handler starts processing of the following message. was unable to write a message to the message RAM. In this case message storage is aborted. In both cases the FIFO put index is not updated. The partly stored message is overwritten when the next message is stored to this location. The flag is also set when the Tx Handler was not able to read a message from the Message RAM in time. In this case message transmission is aborted. In case of a Tx Handler access failure the FDCAN is switched into Restricted Operation Mode (see mode). To leave Restricted Operation Mode, the Host CPU has to reset CCCR.ASM.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: No Message RAM access failure occurred

BitField.name: TOO
BitField.description: Timeout occurred

BitField.name: ELO
BitField.description: Error logging overflow

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: CAN error logging counter did not overflow.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Overflow of CAN error logging counter occurred.

BitField.name: EP
BitField.description: Error passive

BitField.name: EW
BitField.description: Warning status

BitField.name: BO
BitField.description: Bus_Off status

BitField.name: WDI
BitField.description: Watchdog interrupt

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: No message RAM watchdog event occurred

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Message RAM watchdog event due to missing READY

BitField.name: PEA
BitField.description: Protocol error in arbitration phase (nominal bit time is used)

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: No protocol error in arbitration phase

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Protocol error in arbitration phase detected (PSR.LEC different from 0,7)

BitField.name: PED
BitField.description: Protocol error in data phase (data bit time is used)

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: No protocol error in data phase

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Protocol error in data phase detected (PSR.DLEC different from 0,7)

BitField.name: ARA
BitField.description: Access to reserved address

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: No access to reserved address occurred

BitField.name: RF0NE
BitField.description: Rx FIFO 0 new message interrupt enable

BitField.name: RF0FE
BitField.description: Rx FIFO 0 full interrupt enable

BitField.name: RF0LE
BitField.description: Rx FIFO 0 message lost interrupt enable

BitField.name: TFEE

BitField.name: RxFIFO0
BitField.description: RX FIFO bit grouping the following interruption RF0LL: Rx FIFO 0 message lost interrupt line RF0FL: Rx FIFO 0 full interrupt line RF0NL: Rx FIFO 0 new message interrupt line

BitField.name: RxFIFO1
BitField.description: RX FIFO bit grouping the following interruption RF1LL: Rx FIFO 1 message lost interrupt line RF1FL: Rx FIFO 1 full Interrupt line RF1NL: Rx FIFO 1 new message interrupt line

BitField.name: SMSG
BitField.description: Status message bit grouping the following interruption TCFL: Transmission cancellation finished interrupt line TCL: Transmission completed interrupt line HPML: High-priority message interrupt line

BitField.name: TFERR
BitField.description: Tx FIFO ERROR grouping the following interruption TEFLL: Tx event FIFO element lost interrupt line TEFFL: Tx event FIFO full interrupt line TEFNL: Tx event FIFO new entry interrupt line TFEL: Tx FIFO empty interrupt line

BitField.name: MISC
BitField.description: Interrupt regrouping the following interruption TOOL: Timeout occurred interrupt line MRAFL: Message RAM access failure interrupt line TSWL: Timestamp wraparound interrupt line

BitField.name: PERR
BitField.description: Protocol error grouping the following interruption ARAL: Access to reserved address line PEDL: Protocol error in data phase line PEAL: Protocol error in arbitration phase line WDIL: Watchdog interrupt line BOL: Bus_Off status EWL: Warning status interrupt line

BitField.name: EINT0
BitField.description: Enable interrupt line 0

BitField.name: EINT1
BitField.description: Enable interrupt line 1

BitField.name: RRFE
BitField.description: Reject remote frames extended These are protected write (P) bits, which means that write access by the bits is possible only when the bit 1 [CCE] and bit 0 [INIT] of CCCR register are set to 1.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Filter remote frames with 29-bit standard IDs

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Reject all remote frames with 29-bit standard IDs

BitField.name: RRFS
BitField.description: Reject remote frames standard These are protected write (P) bits, which means that write access by the bits is possible only when the bit 1 [CCE] and bit 0 [INIT] of CCCR register are set to 1.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Filter remote frames with 11-bit standard IDs

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Reject all remote frames with 11-bit standard IDs

BitField.name: ANFE
BitField.description: Accept non-matching frames extended Defines how received messages with 29-bit IDs that do not match any element of the filter list are treated. These are protected write (P) bits, which means that write access by the bits is possible only when the bit 1 [CCE] and bit 0 [INIT] of CCCR register are set to 1.

BitField.name: ANFS
BitField.description: Accept Non-matching frames standard Defines how received messages with 11-bit IDs that do not match any element of the filter list are treated. These are protected write (P) bits, which means that write access by the bits is possible only when the bit 1 [CCE] and bit 0 [INIT] of CCCR register are set to 1.

BitField.name: F1OM
BitField.description: FIFO 1 operation mode (overwrite or blocking) This is a protected write (P) bits, which means that write access by the bits is possible only when the bit 1 [CCE] and bit 0 [INIT] of CCCR register are set to 1.

BitField.name: F0OM
BitField.description: FIFO 0 operation mode (overwrite or blocking) This is protected write (P) bits, which means that write access by the bits is possible only when the bit 1 [CCE] and bit 0 [INIT] of CCCR register are set to 1.

BitField.name: LSS
BitField.description: List size standard >28: Values greater than 28 are interpreted as 28. These are protected write (P) bits, which means that write access by the bits is possible only when the bit 1 [CCE] and bit 0 [INIT] of CCCR register are set to 1.

Register.name: FDCAN_XIDAM
Register.description: FDCAN extended ID and mask register

BitField.name: EIDM
BitField.description: Extended ID mask For acceptance filtering of extended frames the Extended ID AND Mask is AND-ed with the Message ID of a received frame. Intended for masking of 29-bit IDs in SAE J1939. With the reset value of all bits set to 1 the mask is not active. These are protected write (P) bits, which means that write access by the bits is possible only when the bit 1 [CCE] and bit 0 [INIT] of CCCR register are set to 1.

BitField.name: BIDX
BitField.description: Buffer index Index of Rx FIFO element to which the message was stored. Only valid when MSI[1] = 1.

BitField.name: MSI
BitField.description: Message storage indicator

BitField.name: FIDX
BitField.description: Filter index Index of matching filter element. Range is 0 to RXGFC[LSS] - 1 or RXGFC[LSE] - 1.

BitField.name: FLST
BitField.description: Filter list Indicates the filter list of the matching filter element.

BitField.name: F0FL
BitField.description: Rx FIFO 0 fill level Number of elements stored in Rx FIFO 0, range 0 to 3.

BitField.name: F0GI
BitField.description: Rx FIFO 0 get index Rx FIFO 0 read index pointer, range 0 to 2.

BitField.name: F0PI
BitField.description: Rx FIFO 0 put index Rx FIFO 0 write index pointer, range 0 to 2.

BitField.name: F0F
BitField.description: Rx FIFO 0 full

BitField.name: RF0L
BitField.description: Rx FIFO 0 message lost This bit is a copy of interrupt flag IR[RF0L]. When IR[RF0L] is reset, this bit is also reset.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Rx FIFO 0 message lost, also set after write attempt to Rx FIFO 0 of size 0

BitField.name: F0AI
BitField.description: Rx FIFO 0 acknowledge index After the Host has read a message or a sequence of messages from Rx FIFO 0 it has to write the buffer index of the last element read from Rx FIFO 0 to F0AI. This sets the Rx FIFOÂ 0 get index RXF0S[F0GI] to F0AI + 1 and update the FIFO 0 fill level RXF0S[F0FL].

BitField.name: F1FL
BitField.description: Rx FIFO 1 fill level Number of elements stored in Rx FIFO 1, range 0 to 3.

BitField.name: F1GI
BitField.description: Rx FIFO 1 get index Rx FIFO 1 read index pointer, range 0 to 2.

BitField.name: F1PI
BitField.description: Rx FIFO 1 put index Rx FIFO 1 write index pointer, range 0 to 2.

BitField.name: F1F
BitField.description: Rx FIFO 1 full

BitField.name: RF1L
BitField.description: Rx FIFO 1 message lost This bit is a copy of interrupt flag IR[RF1L]. When IR[RF1L] is reset, this bit is also reset.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Rx FIFO 1 message lost, also set after write attempt to Rx FIFO 1 of size 0

BitField.name: F1AI
BitField.description: Rx FIFO 1 acknowledge index After the Host has read a message or a sequence of messages from Rx FIFO 1 it has to write the buffer index of the last element read from Rx FIFO 1 to F1AI. This sets the Rx FIFOÂ 1 get index RXF1S[F1GI] to F1AI + 1 and update the FIFO 1 Fill Level RXF1S[F1FL].

BitField.name: TFQM
BitField.description: Tx FIFO/queue mode This is a protected write (P) bit, which means that write access by the bits is possible only when the bit 1 [CCE] and bit 0 [INIT] of CCCR register are set to 1.

BitField.name: TFFL
BitField.description: Tx FIFO free level Number of consecutive free Tx FIFO elements starting from TFGI, range 0 to 3. Read as 0 when Tx queue operation is configured (TXBC[TFQM] = 1).

BitField.name: TFGI
BitField.description: Tx FIFO get index Tx FIFO read index pointer, range 0 to 3. Read as 0 when Tx queue operation is configured (TXBC.TFQM = 1)

BitField.name: TFQPI
BitField.description: Tx FIFO/queue put index Tx FIFO/queue write index pointer, range 0 to 3

BitField.name: TFQF
BitField.description: Tx FIFO/queue full

Register.name: FDCAN_TXBRP
Register.description: FDCAN Tx buffer request pending register

BitField.name: TRP
BitField.description: Transmission request pending Each Tx Buffer has its own transmission request pending bit. The bits are set via register TXBAR. The bits are reset after a requested transmission has completed or has been canceled via register TXBCR. After a TXBRP bit has been set, a Tx scan is started to check for the pending Tx request with the highest priority (Tx Buffer with lowest Message ID). A cancellation request resets the corresponding transmission request pending bit of register TXBRP. In case a transmission has already been started when a cancellation is requested, this is done at the end of the transmission, regardless whether the transmission was successful or not. The cancellation request bits are reset directly after the corresponding TXBRP bit has been reset. After a cancellation has been requested, a finished cancellation is signaled via TXBCF after successful transmission together with the corresponding TXBTO bit when the transmission has not yet been started at the point of cancellation when the transmission has been aborted due to lost arbitration when an error occurred during frame transmission In DAR mode all transmissions are automatically canceled if they are not successful. The corresponding TXBCF bit is set for all unsuccessful transmissions.

Register.name: FDCAN_TXBAR
Register.description: FDCAN Tx buffer add request register

BitField.name: AR
BitField.description: Add request Each Tx buffer has its own add request bit. Writing a 1 sets the corresponding add request bit; writing a 0 has no impact. This enables the Host to set transmission requests for multiple Tx buffers with one write to TXBAR. When no Tx scan is running, the bits are reset immediately, else the bits remain set until the Tx scan process has completed.

Register.name: FDCAN_TXBCR
Register.description: FDCAN Tx buffer cancellation request register

BitField.name: CR
BitField.description: Cancellation request Each Tx buffer has its own cancellation request bit. Writing a 1 sets the corresponding CR bit; writing a 0 has no impact. This enables the Host to set cancellation requests for multiple Tx buffers with one write to TXBCR. The bits remain set until the corresponding TXBRP bit is reset.

Register.name: FDCAN_TXBTO
Register.description: FDCAN Tx buffer transmission occurred register

BitField.name: TO
BitField.description: Transmission occurred. Each Tx buffer has its own TO bit. The bits are set when the corresponding TXBRP bit is cleared after a successful transmission. The bits are reset when a new transmission is requested by writing a 1 to the corresponding bit of register TXBAR.

Register.name: FDCAN_TXBCF
Register.description: FDCAN Tx buffer cancellation finished register

BitField.name: CF
BitField.description: Cancellation finished Each Tx buffer has its own CF bit. The bits are set when the corresponding TXBRP bit is cleared after a cancellation was requested via TXBCR. In case the corresponding TXBRP bit was not set at the point of cancellation, CF is set immediately. The bits are reset when a new transmission is requested by writing a 1 to the corresponding bit of register TXBAR.

Register.name: FDCAN_TXBTIE
Register.description: FDCAN Tx buffer transmission interrupt enable register

BitField.name: TIE
BitField.description: Transmission interrupt enable Each Tx buffer has its own TIE bit.

Register.name: FDCAN_TXBCIE
Register.description: FDCAN Tx buffer cancellation finished interrupt enable register

BitField.name: CFIE
BitField.description: Cancellation finished interrupt enable. Each Tx buffer has its own CFIE bit.

Register.name: FDCAN_TXEFS
Register.description: FDCAN Tx event FIFO status register

BitField.name: EFFL
BitField.description: Event FIFO fill level Number of elements stored in Tx event FIFO, range 0 to 3.

BitField.name: EFGI
BitField.description: Event FIFO get index Tx Event FIFO read index pointer, range 0 to 3.

BitField.name: EFPI
BitField.description: Event FIFO put index Tx Event FIFO write index pointer, range 0 to 3.

BitField.name: EFF
BitField.description: Event FIFO full

BitField.name: TEFL
BitField.description: Tx Event FIFO element lost This bit is a copy of interrupt flag IR[TEFL]. When IR[TEFL] is reset, this bit is also reset. 0 No Tx event FIFO element lost 1 Tx event FIFO element lost, also set after write attempt to Tx Event FIFO of size 0.

Register.name: FDCAN_TXEFA
Register.description: FDCAN Tx event FIFO acknowledge register

BitField.name: EFAI
BitField.description: Event FIFO acknowledge index After the Host has read an element or a sequence of elements from the Tx event FIFO, it has to write the index of the last element read from Tx event FIFO to EFAI. This sets the Tx event FIFO get index TXEFS[EFGI] to EFAI + 1 and updates the FIFO 0 fill level TXEFS[EFFL].

BitField.name: PDIV
BitField.description: input clock divider The APB clock could be divided prior to be used by the CAN sub system. The rate must be computed using the divider output clock. These are protected write (P) bits, which means that write access by the bits is possible only when the bit 1 [CCE] and bit 0 [INIT] of CCCR register are set to 1.

BitField.name: ETV
BitField.description: Endianness test value The endianness test value is 0x8765 4321.

Register.name: FDCAN_DBTP
Register.description: FDCAN data bit timing and prescaler register

BitField.name: DSJW
BitField.description: Synchronization jump width Must always be smaller than DTSEG2, valid values are 0 to 15. The value used by the hardware is the one programmed, incremented by 1: tSJW = (DSJW + 1) x tq.

BitField.name: DTSEG2
BitField.description: Data time segment after sample point Valid values are 0 to 15. The value used by the hardware is the one programmed, incremented by 1, i.e. tBS2 = (DTSEG2 + 1) x tq.

BitField.name: DTSEG1
BitField.description: Data time segment before sample point Valid values are 0 to 31. The value used by the hardware is the one programmed, incremented by 1, i.e. tBS1 = (DTSEG1 + 1) x tq.

BitField.name: DBRP
BitField.description: Data bit rate prescaler The value by which the oscillator frequency is divided to generate the bit time quanta. The bit time is built up from a multiple of this quanta. Valid values for the Baud Rate Prescaler are 0 to 31. The hardware interpreters this value as the value programmed plus 1.

BitField.name: TDC
BitField.description: Transceiver delay compensation

BitField.name: LBCK
BitField.description: Loop back mode

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Reset value, Loop Back mode is disabled

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Loop Back mode is enabled (see Power down (Sleep mode))

BitField.name: TX
BitField.description: Control of transmit pin

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Reset value, FDCANx_TX TX is controlled by the CAN core, updated at the end of the CAN bit time

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Sample point can be monitored at pin FDCANx_TX

BitField.name: RX
BitField.description: Receive pin Monitors the actual value of pin FDCANx_RX

BitField.name: WDC
BitField.description: Watchdog configuration Start value of the message RAM watchdog counter. With the reset value of 00, the counter is disabled. These are protected write (P) bits, write access is possible only when the bit 1 [CCE] and bit 0 [INIT] of FDCAN_CCCR register are set to 1.

BitField.name: WDV
BitField.description: Watchdog value Actual message RAM watchdog counter value.

BitField.name: CCE
BitField.description: Configuration change enable

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The CPU has no write access to the protected configuration registers.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The CPU has write access to the protected configuration registers (while CCCR.INIT = 1).

BitField.name: ASM
BitField.description: ASM restricted operation mode The restricted operation mode is intended for applications that adapt themselves to different CAN bit rates. The application tests different bit rates and leaves the Restricted Operation Mode after it has received a valid frame. In the optional Restricted Operation Mode the node is able to transmit and receive data and remote frames and it gives acknowledge to valid frames, but it does not send active error frames or overload frames. In case of an error condition or overload condition, it does not send dominant bits, instead it waits for the occurrence of bus idle condition to resynchronize itself to the CAN communication. The error counters are not incremented. Bit ASM can only be set by software when both CCE and INIT are set to 1. The bit can be reset by the software at any time.

BitField.name: CSA
BitField.description: Clock stop acknowledge

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: FDCAN may be set in power down by stopping APB clock and kernel clock.

BitField.name: CSR
BitField.description: Clock stop request

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Clock stop requested. When clock stop is requested, first INIT and then CSA is set after all pending transfer requests have been completed and the CAN bus reached idle.

BitField.name: MON
BitField.description: Bus monitoring mode Bit MON can only be set by software when both CCE and INIT are set to 1. The bit can be reset by the Host at any time.

BitField.name: DAR
BitField.description: Disable automatic retransmission

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Automatic retransmission of messages not transmitted successfully enabled

BitField.name: TEST
BitField.description: Test mode enable

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Normal operation, register TEST holds reset values

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Test Mode, write access to register TEST enabled

BitField.name: FDOE
BitField.description: FD operation enable

BitField.name: BRSE
BitField.description: FDCAN bit rate switching

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Bit rate switching for transmissions disabled

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Bit rate switching for transmissions enabled

BitField.name: PXHD
BitField.description: Protocol exception handling disable

BitField.name: EFBI
BitField.description: Edge filtering during bus integration

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Two consecutive dominant tq required to detect an edge for hard synchronization

BitField.name: TXP
BitField.description: If this bit is set, the FDCAN pauses for two CAN bit times before starting the next transmission after successfully transmitting a frame.

BitField.name: NISO
BitField.description: Non ISO operation If this bit is set, the FDCAN uses the CAN FD frame format as specified by the Bosch CAN FD Specification V1.0.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: CAN FD frame format according to ISO11898-1

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: CAN FD frame format according to Bosch CAN FD Specification V1.0

Register.name: FDCAN_NBTP
Register.description: FDCAN nominal bit timing and prescaler register

BitField.name: NTSEG2
BitField.description: Nominal time segment after sample point Valid values are 0 to 127. The actual interpretation by the hardware of this value is such that one more than the programmed value is used.

BitField.name: NTSEG1
BitField.description: Nominal time segment before sample point Valid values are 0 to 255. The actual interpretation by the hardware of this value is such that one more than the programmed value is used. These are protected write (P) bits, write access is possible only when the bit 1 [CCE] and bit 0 [INIT] of CCCR register are set to 1.

BitField.name: NBRP
BitField.description: Bit rate prescaler Value by which the oscillator frequency is divided for generating the bit time quanta. The bit time is built up from a multiple of this quanta. Valid values are 0 to 511. The actual interpretation by the hardware of this value is such that one more than the value programmed here is used. These are protected write (P) bits, write access is possible only when the bit 1 [CCE] and bit 0 [INIT] of CCCR register are set to 1.

BitField.name: NSJW
BitField.description: Nominal (re)synchronization jump width Valid values are 0 to 127. The actual interpretation by the hardware of this value is such that the used value is the one programmed incremented by one. These are protected write (P) bits, write access is possible only when the bit 1 [CCE] and bit 0 [INIT] of CCCR register are set to 1.

BitField.name: TSS
BitField.description: Timestamp select These are protected write (P) bits, write access is possible only when the bit 1 [CCE] and bit 0 [INIT] of CCCR register are set to 1.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Timestamp counter value incremented according to TCP

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: External timestamp counter from TIM3 value (tim3_cnt[0:15])

BitField.name: TCP
BitField.description: Timestamp counter prescaler Configures the timestamp and timeout counters time unit in multiples of CAN bit times [1 â¦ 16]. The actual interpretation by the hardware of this value is such that one more than the value programmed here is used. In CAN FD mode the internal timestamp counter TCP does not provide a constant time base due to the different CAN bit times between arbitration phase and data phase. Thus CAN FD requires an external counter for timestamp generation (TSS = 10). These are protected write (P) bits, write access is possible only when the bit 1 [CCE] and bit 0 [INIT] of CCCR register are set to 1.

BitField.name: TSC
BitField.description: Timestamp counter The internal/external timestamp counter value is captured on start of frame (both Rx and Tx). When TSCC[TSS] = 01, the timestamp counter is incremented in multiples of CAN bit times [1 â¦ 16] depending on the configuration of TSCC[TCP]. A wrap around sets interrupt flag IR[TSW]. Write access resets the counter to 0. When TSCC.TSS = 10, TSC reflects the external timestamp counter value. A write access has no impact.

BitField.name: ETOC
BitField.description: Timeout counter enable This is a protected write (P) bit, write access is possible only when the bit 1 [CCE] and bit 0 [INIT] of CCCR register are set to 1.

BitField.name: TOS
BitField.description: Timeout select When operating in Continuous mode, a write to TOCV presets the counter to the value configured by TOCC[TOP] and continues down-counting. When the timeout counter is controlled by one of the FIFOs, an empty FIFO presets the counter to the value configured by TOCC[TOP]. Down-counting is started when the first FIFO element is stored. These are protected write (P) bits, write access is possible only when the bit 1 [CCE] and bit 0 [INIT] of CCCR register are set to 1.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Timeout controlled by Tx Event FIFO

BitField.name: TOP
BitField.description: Timeout period Start value of the timeout counter (down-counter). Configures the timeout period.

BitField.name: TOC
BitField.description: Timeout counter The timeout counter is decremented in multiples of CAN bit times [1 â¦ 16] depending on the configuration of TSCC.TCP. When decremented to 0, interrupt flag IR.TOO is set and the Timeout Counter is stopped. Start and reset/restart conditions are configured via TOCC.TOS.

BitField.name: TEC
BitField.description: Transmit error counter Actual state of the transmit error counter, values between 0 and 255. When CCCR.ASM is set, the CAN protocol controller does not increment TEC and REC when a CAN protocol error is detected, but CEL is still incremented.

BitField.name: REC
BitField.description: Receive error counter Actual state of the receive error counter, values between 0 and 127.

BitField.name: RP
BitField.description: Receive error passive

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The receive error counter is below the error passive level of 128.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The receive error counter has reached the error passive level of 128.

BitField.name: CEL
BitField.description: CAN error logging The counter is incremented each time when a CAN protocol error causes the transmit error counter or the receive error counter to be incremented. It is reset by read access to CEL. The counter stops at 0xFF; the next increment of TEC or REC sets interrupt flag IR[ELO]. Access type is RX: reset on read.

BitField.name: LEC
BitField.description: Last error code The LEC indicates the type of the last error to occur on the CAN bus. This field is cleared to 0 when a message has been transferred (reception or transmission) without error. Access type is RS: set on read.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: No Error: No error occurred since LEC has been reset by successful reception or transmission.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Stuff Error: More than 5 equal bits in a sequence have occurred in a part of a received message where this is not allowed.

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: Form Error: A fixed format part of a received frame has the wrong format.

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: AckError: The message transmitted by the FDCAN was not acknowledged by another node.

Enum.name: B_0x4
Enum.description: Bit1Error: During the transmission of a message (with the exception of the arbitration field), the device wanted to send a recessive level (bit of logical value 1), but the monitored bus value was dominant.

Enum.name: B_0x5
Enum.description: Bit0Error: During the transmission of a message (or acknowledge bit, or active error flag, or overload flag), the device wanted to send a dominant level (data or identifier bit logical value 0), but the monitored bus value was recessive. During Bus_Off recovery this status is set each time a sequence of 11 recessive bits has been monitored. This enables the CPU to monitor the proceeding of the Bus_Off recovery sequence (indicating the bus is not stuck at dominant or continuously disturbed).

Enum.name: B_0x6
Enum.description: CRCError: The CRC check sum of a received message was incorrect. The CRC of an incoming message does not match with the CRC calculated from the received data.

Enum.name: B_0x7
Enum.description: NoChange: Any read access to the Protocol status register re-initializes the LEC to '7â. When the LEC shows the value '7â, no CAN bus event was detected since the last CPU read access to the Protocol status register.

BitField.name: ACT
BitField.description: Activity Monitors the moduleâs CAN communication state.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Synchronizing: node is synchronizing on CAN communication.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Idle: node is neither receiver nor transmitter.

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: Receiver: node is operating as receiver.

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: Transmitter: node is operating as transmitter.

BitField.name: EP
BitField.description: Error passive

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The FDCAN is in the Error_Active state. It normally takes part in bus communication and sends an active error flag when an error has been detected.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The FDCAN is in the Error_Passive state.

BitField.name: EW
BitField.description: Warning Sstatus

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Both error counters are below the Error_Warning limit of 96.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: At least one of error counter has reached the Error_Warning limit of 96.

BitField.name: BO
BitField.description: Bus_Off status

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The FDCAN is in Bus_Off state.

BitField.name: DLEC
BitField.description: Data last error code Type of last error that occurred in the data phase of a FDCAN format frame with its BRS flag set. Coding is the same as for LEC. This field is cleared to 0 when a FDCAN format frame with its BRS flag set has been transferred (reception or transmission) without error. Access type is RS: set on read.

BitField.name: RESI
BitField.description: ESI flag of last received FDCAN message This bit is set together with REDL, independent of acceptance filtering. Access type is RX: reset on read.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Last received FDCAN message did not have its ESI flag set.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Last received FDCAN message had its ESI flag set.

BitField.name: RBRS
BitField.description: BRS flag of last received FDCAN message This bit is set together with REDL, independent of acceptance filtering. Access type is RX: reset on read.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Last received FDCAN message did not have its BRS flag set.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Last received FDCAN message had its BRS flag set.

BitField.name: REDL
BitField.description: Received FDCAN message This bit is set independent of acceptance filtering. Access type is RX: reset on read.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Since this bit was reset by the CPU, no FDCAN message has been received.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Message in FDCAN format with EDL flag set has been received.

BitField.name: PXE
BitField.description: Protocol exception event

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: No protocol exception event occurred since last read access

BitField.name: TDCV
BitField.description: Transmitter delay compensation value Position of the secondary sample point, defined by the sum of the measured delay from FDCAN_TX to FDCAN_RX and TDCR.TDCO. The SSP position is, in the data phase, the number of minimum time quanta (mtq) between the start of the transmitted bit and the secondary sample point. Valid values are 0 to 127 mtq.

BitField.name: TDCF
BitField.description: Transmitter delay compensation filter window length Defines the minimum value for the SSP position, dominant edges on FDCAN_RX that would result in an earlier SSP position are ignored for transmitter delay measurements. These are protected write (P) bits, which means that write access by the bits is possible only when the bit 1 [CCE] and bit 0 [INIT] of CCCR register are set to 1.

BitField.name: TDCO
BitField.description: Transmitter delay compensation offset Offset value defining the distance between the measured delay from FDCAN_TX to FDCAN_RX and the secondary sample point. Valid values are 0 to 127 mtq. These are protected write (P) bits, which means that write access by the bits is possible only when the bit 1 [CCE] and bit 0 [INIT] of CCCR register are set to 1.

BitField.name: RF0N
BitField.description: Rx FIFO 0 new message

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: No new message written to Rx FIFO 0

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: New message written to Rx FIFO 0

BitField.name: RF0F
BitField.description: Rx FIFO 0 full

BitField.name: RF0L
BitField.description: Rx FIFO 0 message lost

BitField.name: RF1N
BitField.description: Rx FIFO 1 new message

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: No new message written to Rx FIFO 1

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: New message written to Rx FIFO 1

BitField.name: RF1F
BitField.description: Rx FIFO 1 full

BitField.name: RF1L
BitField.description: Rx FIFO 1 message lost

BitField.name: HPM
BitField.description: High-priority message

BitField.name: TC
BitField.description: Transmission completed

BitField.name: TCF
BitField.description: Transmission cancellation finished

BitField.name: TFE
BitField.description: Tx FIFO empty

BitField.name: TEFN
BitField.description: Tx event FIFO New Entry

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Tx handler wrote Tx event FIFO element.

BitField.name: TEFF
BitField.description: Tx event FIFO full

BitField.name: TEFL
BitField.description: Tx event FIFO element lost

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: No Tx event FIFO element lost

BitField.name: TSW
BitField.description: Timestamp wraparound

BitField.name: MRAF
BitField.description: Message RAM access failure The flag is set when the Rx handler: has not completed acceptance filtering or storage of an accepted message until the arbitration field of the following message has been received. In this case acceptance filtering or message storage is aborted and the Rx Handler starts processing of the following message. was unable to write a message to the message RAM. In this case message storage is aborted. In both cases the FIFO put index is not updated. The partly stored message is overwritten when the next message is stored to this location. The flag is also set when the Tx Handler was not able to read a message from the Message RAM in time. In this case message transmission is aborted. In case of a Tx Handler access failure the FDCAN is switched into Restricted Operation Mode (see mode). To leave Restricted Operation Mode, the Host CPU has to reset CCCR.ASM.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: No Message RAM access failure occurred

BitField.name: TOO
BitField.description: Timeout occurred

BitField.name: ELO
BitField.description: Error logging overflow

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: CAN error logging counter did not overflow.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Overflow of CAN error logging counter occurred.

BitField.name: EP
BitField.description: Error passive

BitField.name: EW
BitField.description: Warning status

BitField.name: BO
BitField.description: Bus_Off status

BitField.name: WDI
BitField.description: Watchdog interrupt

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: No message RAM watchdog event occurred

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Message RAM watchdog event due to missing READY

BitField.name: PEA
BitField.description: Protocol error in arbitration phase (nominal bit time is used)

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: No protocol error in arbitration phase

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Protocol error in arbitration phase detected (PSR.LEC different from 0,7)

BitField.name: PED
BitField.description: Protocol error in data phase (data bit time is used)

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: No protocol error in data phase

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Protocol error in data phase detected (PSR.DLEC different from 0,7)

BitField.name: ARA
BitField.description: Access to reserved address

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: No access to reserved address occurred

BitField.name: RF0NE
BitField.description: Rx FIFO 0 new message interrupt enable

BitField.name: RF0FE
BitField.description: Rx FIFO 0 full interrupt enable

BitField.name: RF0LE
BitField.description: Rx FIFO 0 message lost interrupt enable

BitField.name: RF1NE
BitField.description: Rx FIFO 1 new message interrupt enable

BitField.name: RF1FE
BitField.description: Rx FIFO 1 full interrupt enable

BitField.name: RF1LE
BitField.description: Rx FIFO 1 message lost interrupt enable

BitField.name: HPME
BitField.description: High-priority message interrupt enable

BitField.name: TCE
BitField.description: Transmission completed interrupt enable

BitField.name: TCFE
BitField.description: Transmission cancellation finished interrupt enable

BitField.name: TFEE
BitField.description: Tx FIFO empty interrupt enable

BitField.name: TEFNE
BitField.description: Tx event FIFO new entry interrupt enable

BitField.name: TEFFE
BitField.description: Tx event FIFO full interrupt enable

BitField.name: TEFLE
BitField.description: Tx event FIFO element lost interrupt enable

BitField.name: TSWE
BitField.description: Timestamp wraparound interrupt enable

BitField.name: MRAFE
BitField.description: Message RAM access failure interrupt enable

BitField.name: TOOE
BitField.description: Timeout occurred interrupt enable

BitField.name: ELOE
BitField.description: Error logging overflow interrupt enable

BitField.name: EPE
BitField.description: Error passive interrupt enable

BitField.name: EWE
BitField.description: Warning status interrupt enable

BitField.name: BOE
BitField.description: Bus_Off status

BitField.name: WDIE
BitField.description: Watchdog interrupt enable

BitField.name: PEAE
BitField.description: Protocol error in arbitration phase enable

BitField.name: PEDE
BitField.description: Protocol error in data phase enable

BitField.name: ARAE
BitField.description: Access to reserved address enable

BitField.name: RxFIFO0
BitField.description: RX FIFO bit grouping the following interruption RF0LL: Rx FIFO 0 message lost interrupt line RF0FL: Rx FIFO 0 full interrupt line RF0NL: Rx FIFO 0 new message interrupt line

BitField.name: RxFIFO1
BitField.description: RX FIFO bit grouping the following interruption RF1LL: Rx FIFO 1 message lost interrupt line RF1FL: Rx FIFO 1 full Interrupt line RF1NL: Rx FIFO 1 new message interrupt line

BitField.name: SMSG
BitField.description: Status message bit grouping the following interruption TCFL: Transmission cancellation finished interrupt line TCL: Transmission completed interrupt line HPML: High-priority message interrupt line

BitField.name: TFERR
BitField.description: Tx FIFO ERROR grouping the following interruption TEFLL: Tx event FIFO element lost interrupt line TEFFL: Tx event FIFO full interrupt line TEFNL: Tx event FIFO new entry interrupt line TFEL: Tx FIFO empty interrupt line

BitField.name: MISC
BitField.description: Interrupt regrouping the following interruption TOOL: Timeout occurred interrupt line MRAFL: Message RAM access failure interrupt line TSWL: Timestamp wraparound interrupt line

BitField.name: PERR
BitField.description: Protocol error grouping the following interruption ARAL: Access to reserved address line PEDL: Protocol error in data phase line PEAL: Protocol error in arbitration phase line WDIL: Watchdog interrupt line BOL: Bus_Off status EWL: Warning status interrupt line

BitField.name: EINT0
BitField.description: Enable interrupt line 0

BitField.name: EINT1
BitField.description: Enable interrupt line 1

BitField.name: RRFE
BitField.description: Reject remote frames extended These are protected write (P) bits, which means that write access by the bits is possible only when the bit 1 [CCE] and bit 0 [INIT] of CCCR register are set to 1.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Filter remote frames with 29-bit standard IDs

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Reject all remote frames with 29-bit standard IDs

BitField.name: RRFS
BitField.description: Reject remote frames standard These are protected write (P) bits, which means that write access by the bits is possible only when the bit 1 [CCE] and bit 0 [INIT] of CCCR register are set to 1.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Filter remote frames with 11-bit standard IDs

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Reject all remote frames with 11-bit standard IDs

BitField.name: ANFE
BitField.description: Accept non-matching frames extended Defines how received messages with 29-bit IDs that do not match any element of the filter list are treated. These are protected write (P) bits, which means that write access by the bits is possible only when the bit 1 [CCE] and bit 0 [INIT] of CCCR register are set to 1.

BitField.name: ANFS
BitField.description: Accept Non-matching frames standard Defines how received messages with 11-bit IDs that do not match any element of the filter list are treated. These are protected write (P) bits, which means that write access by the bits is possible only when the bit 1 [CCE] and bit 0 [INIT] of CCCR register are set to 1.

BitField.name: F1OM
BitField.description: FIFO 1 operation mode (overwrite or blocking) This is a protected write (P) bits, which means that write access by the bits is possible only when the bit 1 [CCE] and bit 0 [INIT] of CCCR register are set to 1.

BitField.name: F0OM
BitField.description: FIFO 0 operation mode (overwrite or blocking) This is protected write (P) bits, which means that write access by the bits is possible only when the bit 1 [CCE] and bit 0 [INIT] of CCCR register are set to 1.

BitField.name: LSS
BitField.description: List size standard >28: Values greater than 28 are interpreted as 28. These are protected write (P) bits, which means that write access by the bits is possible only when the bit 1 [CCE] and bit 0 [INIT] of CCCR register are set to 1.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Number of standard message ID filter elements

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: Number of standard message ID filter elements

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: Number of standard message ID filter elements

Enum.description: Number of standard message ID filter elements

BitField.name: LSE
BitField.description: List size extended >8: Values greater than 8 are interpreted as 8. These are protected write (P) bits, which means that write access by the bits is possible only when the bit 1 [CCE] and bit 0 [INIT] of CCCR register are set to 1.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Number of extended message ID filter elements

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: Number of extended message ID filter elements

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: Number of extended message ID filter elements

Enum.name: B_0x4
Enum.description: Number of extended message ID filter elements

Enum.name: B_0x5
Enum.description: Number of extended message ID filter elements

Enum.name: B_0x6
Enum.description: Number of extended message ID filter elements

Enum.name: B_0x7
Enum.description: Number of extended message ID filter elements

Enum.name: B_0x8
Enum.description: Number of extended message ID filter elements

Register.name: FDCAN_XIDAM
Register.description: FDCAN extended ID and mask register

BitField.name: EIDM
BitField.description: Extended ID mask For acceptance filtering of extended frames the Extended ID AND Mask is AND-ed with the Message ID of a received frame. Intended for masking of 29-bit IDs in SAE J1939. With the reset value of all bits set to 1 the mask is not active. These are protected write (P) bits, which means that write access by the bits is possible only when the bit 1 [CCE] and bit 0 [INIT] of CCCR register are set to 1.

BitField.name: BIDX
BitField.description: Buffer index Index of Rx FIFO element to which the message was stored. Only valid when MSI[1] = 1.

BitField.name: MSI
BitField.description: Message storage indicator

BitField.name: FIDX
BitField.description: Filter index Index of matching filter element. Range is 0 to RXGFC[LSS] - 1 or RXGFC[LSE] - 1.

BitField.name: FLST
BitField.description: Filter list Indicates the filter list of the matching filter element.

BitField.name: F0FL
BitField.description: Rx FIFO 0 fill level Number of elements stored in Rx FIFO 0, range 0 to 3.

BitField.name: F0GI
BitField.description: Rx FIFO 0 get index Rx FIFO 0 read index pointer, range 0 to 2.

BitField.name: F0PI
BitField.description: Rx FIFO 0 put index Rx FIFO 0 write index pointer, range 0 to 2.

BitField.name: F0F
BitField.description: Rx FIFO 0 full

BitField.name: RF0L
BitField.description: Rx FIFO 0 message lost This bit is a copy of interrupt flag IR[RF0L]. When IR[RF0L] is reset, this bit is also reset.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Rx FIFO 0 message lost, also set after write attempt to Rx FIFO 0 of size 0

BitField.name: F0AI
BitField.description: Rx FIFO 0 acknowledge index After the Host has read a message or a sequence of messages from Rx FIFO 0 it has to write the buffer index of the last element read from Rx FIFO 0 to F0AI. This sets the Rx FIFOÂ 0 get index RXF0S[F0GI] to F0AI + 1 and update the FIFO 0 fill level RXF0S[F0FL].

BitField.name: F1FL
BitField.description: Rx FIFO 1 fill level Number of elements stored in Rx FIFO 1, range 0 to 3.

BitField.name: F1GI
BitField.description: Rx FIFO 1 get index Rx FIFO 1 read index pointer, range 0 to 2.

BitField.name: F1PI
BitField.description: Rx FIFO 1 put index Rx FIFO 1 write index pointer, range 0 to 2.

BitField.name: F1F
BitField.description: Rx FIFO 1 full

BitField.name: RF1L
BitField.description: Rx FIFO 1 message lost This bit is a copy of interrupt flag IR[RF1L]. When IR[RF1L] is reset, this bit is also reset.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Rx FIFO 1 message lost, also set after write attempt to Rx FIFO 1 of size 0

BitField.name: F1AI
BitField.description: Rx FIFO 1 acknowledge index After the Host has read a message or a sequence of messages from Rx FIFO 1 it has to write the buffer index of the last element read from Rx FIFO 1 to F1AI. This sets the Rx FIFOÂ 1 get index RXF1S[F1GI] to F1AI + 1 and update the FIFO 1 Fill Level RXF1S[F1FL].

BitField.name: TFQM
BitField.description: Tx FIFO/queue mode This is a protected write (P) bit, which means that write access by the bits is possible only when the bit 1 [CCE] and bit 0 [INIT] of CCCR register are set to 1.

BitField.name: TFFL
BitField.description: Tx FIFO free level Number of consecutive free Tx FIFO elements starting from TFGI, range 0 to 3. Read as 0 when Tx queue operation is configured (TXBC[TFQM] = 1).

BitField.name: TFGI
BitField.description: Tx FIFO get index Tx FIFO read index pointer, range 0 to 3. Read as 0 when Tx queue operation is configured (TXBC.TFQM = 1)

BitField.name: TFQPI
BitField.description: Tx FIFO/queue put index Tx FIFO/queue write index pointer, range 0 to 3

BitField.name: TFQF
BitField.description: Tx FIFO/queue full

Register.name: FDCAN_TXBRP
Register.description: FDCAN Tx buffer request pending register

BitField.name: TRP
BitField.description: Transmission request pending Each Tx Buffer has its own transmission request pending bit. The bits are set via register TXBAR. The bits are reset after a requested transmission has completed or has been canceled via register TXBCR. After a TXBRP bit has been set, a Tx scan is started to check for the pending Tx request with the highest priority (Tx Buffer with lowest Message ID). A cancellation request resets the corresponding transmission request pending bit of register TXBRP. In case a transmission has already been started when a cancellation is requested, this is done at the end of the transmission, regardless whether the transmission was successful or not. The cancellation request bits are reset directly after the corresponding TXBRP bit has been reset. After a cancellation has been requested, a finished cancellation is signaled via TXBCF after successful transmission together with the corresponding TXBTO bit when the transmission has not yet been started at the point of cancellation when the transmission has been aborted due to lost arbitration when an error occurred during frame transmission In DAR mode all transmissions are automatically canceled if they are not successful. The corresponding TXBCF bit is set for all unsuccessful transmissions.

Register.name: FDCAN_TXBAR
Register.description: FDCAN Tx buffer add request register

BitField.name: AR
BitField.description: Add request Each Tx buffer has its own add request bit. Writing a 1 sets the corresponding add request bit; writing a 0 has no impact. This enables the Host to set transmission requests for multiple Tx buffers with one write to TXBAR. When no Tx scan is running, the bits are reset immediately, else the bits remain set until the Tx scan process has completed.

Register.name: FDCAN_TXBCR
Register.description: FDCAN Tx buffer cancellation request register

BitField.name: CR
BitField.description: Cancellation request Each Tx buffer has its own cancellation request bit. Writing a 1 sets the corresponding CR bit; writing a 0 has no impact. This enables the Host to set cancellation requests for multiple Tx buffers with one write to TXBCR. The bits remain set until the corresponding TXBRP bit is reset.

Register.name: FDCAN_TXBTO
Register.description: FDCAN Tx buffer transmission occurred register

BitField.name: TO
BitField.description: Transmission occurred. Each Tx buffer has its own TO bit. The bits are set when the corresponding TXBRP bit is cleared after a successful transmission. The bits are reset when a new transmission is requested by writing a 1 to the corresponding bit of register TXBAR.

Register.name: FDCAN_TXBCF
Register.description: FDCAN Tx buffer cancellation finished register

BitField.name: CF
BitField.description: Cancellation finished Each Tx buffer has its own CF bit. The bits are set when the corresponding TXBRP bit is cleared after a cancellation was requested via TXBCR. In case the corresponding TXBRP bit was not set at the point of cancellation, CF is set immediately. The bits are reset when a new transmission is requested by writing a 1 to the corresponding bit of register TXBAR.

Register.name: FDCAN_TXBTIE
Register.description: FDCAN Tx buffer transmission interrupt enable register

BitField.name: TIE
BitField.description: Transmission interrupt enable Each Tx buffer has its own TIE bit.

Register.name: FDCAN_TXBCIE
Register.description: FDCAN Tx buffer cancellation finished interrupt enable register

BitField.name: CFIE
BitField.description: Cancellation finished interrupt enable. Each Tx buffer has its own CFIE bit.

Register.name: FDCAN_TXEFS
Register.description: FDCAN Tx event FIFO status register

BitField.name: EFFL
BitField.description: Event FIFO fill level Number of elements stored in Tx event FIFO, range 0 to 3.

BitField.name: EFGI
BitField.description: Event FIFO get index Tx Event FIFO read index pointer, range 0 to 3.

BitField.name: EFPI
BitField.description: Event FIFO put index Tx Event FIFO write index pointer, range 0 to 3.

BitField.name: EFF
BitField.description: Event FIFO full

BitField.name: TEFL
BitField.description: Tx Event FIFO element lost This bit is a copy of interrupt flag IR[TEFL]. When IR[TEFL] is reset, this bit is also reset. 0 No Tx event FIFO element lost 1 Tx event FIFO element lost, also set after write attempt to Tx Event FIFO of size 0.

Register.name: FDCAN_TXEFA
Register.description: FDCAN Tx event FIFO acknowledge register

BitField.name: EFAI
BitField.description: Event FIFO acknowledge index After the Host has read an element or a sequence of elements from the Tx event FIFO, it has to write the index of the last element read from Tx event FIFO to EFAI. This sets the Tx event FIFO get index TXEFS[EFGI] to EFAI + 1 and updates the FIFO 0 fill level TXEFS[EFFL].

BitField.name: PDIV
BitField.description: input clock divider The APB clock could be divided prior to be used by the CAN sub system. The rate must be computed using the divider output clock. These are protected write (P) bits, which means that write access by the bits is possible only when the bit 1 [CCE] and bit 0 [INIT] of CCCR register are set to 1.
