BitField.name: CECEN
BitField.description: CEC enable The CECEN bit is set and cleared by software. CECEN = 1 starts message reception and enables the TXSOM control. CECEN = 0 disables the CEC peripheral, clears all bits of CEC_CR register and aborts any on-going reception or transmission.

BitField.name: TXSOM
BitField.description: Tx start of message TXSOM is set by software to command transmission of the first byte of a CEC message. If the CEC message consists of only one byte, TXEOM must be set before of TXSOM. Start-bit is effectively started on the CEC line after SFT is counted. If TXSOM is set while a message reception is ongoing, transmission starts after the end of reception. TXSOM is cleared by hardware after the last byte of the message is sent with a positive acknowledge (TXEND = 1), in case of transmission underrun (TXUDR = 1), negative acknowledge (TXACKE = 1), and transmission error (TXERR = 1). It is also cleared by CECEN = 0. It is not cleared and transmission is automatically retried in case of arbitration lost (ARBLST = 1). TXSOM can be also used as a status bit informing application whether any transmission request is pending or under execution. The application can abort a transmission request at any time by clearing the CECEN bit. Note: TXSOM must be set when CECEN = 1. TXSOM must be set when transmission data is available into TXDR. HEADER first four bits containing own peripheral address are taken from TXDR[7:4], not from CEC_CFGR.OAR that is used only for reception.

BitField.name: TXEOM
BitField.description: Tx end of message The TXEOM bit is set by software to command transmission of the last byte of a CEC message. TXEOM is cleared by hardware at the same time and under the same conditions as for TXSOM. Note: TXEOM must be set when CECEN = 1. TXEOM must be set before writing transmission data to TXDR. If TXEOM is set when TXSOM = 0, transmitted message consists of 1 byte (HEADER) only (PING message).

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: TXDR data byte is transmitted with EOM = 0

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: TXDR data byte is transmitted with EOM = 1

Register.name: CEC_CFGR
Register.description: This register is used to configure the HDMI-CEC controller. It is mandatory to write CEC_CFGR only when CECEN=0.

BitField.name: SFT
BitField.description: Signal free time SFT bits are set by software. In the SFT = 0x0 configuration, the number of nominal data bit periods waited before transmission is ruled by hardware according to the transmission history. In all the other configurations the SFT number is determined by software. 0x0 2.5 data-bit periods if CEC is the last bus initiator with unsuccessful transmission (ARBLST = 1, TXERR = 1, TXUDR = 1 or TXACKE = 1) 4 data-bit periods if CEC is the new bus initiator 6 data-bit periods if CEC is the last bus initiator with successful transmission (TXEOM = 1)

BitField.name: RXTOL
BitField.description: Rx-tolerance The RXTOL bit is set and cleared by software. Start-bit, +/- 200 µs rise, +/- 200 µs fall Data-bit: +/- 200 µs rise. +/- 350 µs fall Start-bit: +/- 400 µs rise, +/- 400 µs fall Data-bit: +/-300 µs rise, +/- 500 µs fall

BitField.name: BRESTP
BitField.description: Rx-stop on bit rising error The BRESTP bit is set and cleared by software.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: BRE detection does not stop reception of the CEC message. Data bit is sampled at 1.05 ms.

BitField.name: BREGEN
BitField.description: Generate error-bit on bit rising error The BREGEN bit is set and cleared by software. Note: If BRDNOGEN = 0, an error-bit is generated upon BRE detection with BRESTP = 1 in broadcast even if BREGEN = 0.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: BRE detection does not generate an error-bit on the CEC line.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: BRE detection generates an error-bit on the CEC line (if BRESTP is set).

BitField.name: LBPEGEN
BitField.description: Generate error-bit on long bit period error The LBPEGEN bit is set and cleared by software. Note: If BRDNOGEN = 0, an error-bit is generated upon LBPE detection in broadcast even if LBPEGEN = 0.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: LBPE detection does not generate an error-bit on the CEC line.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: LBPE detection generates an error-bit on the CEC line.

BitField.name: BRDNOGEN
BitField.description: Avoid error-bit generation in broadcast The BRDNOGEN bit is set and cleared by software. error-bit on the CEC line. LBPE detection with LBPEGEN = 0 on a broadcast message generates an error-bit on the CEC line.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: BRE detection with BRESTP = 1 and BREGEN = 0 on a broadcast message generates an

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Error-bit is not generated in the same condition as above. An error-bit is not generated even in case of an SBPE detection in a broadcast message if listen mode is set.

BitField.name: SFTOP
BitField.description: SFT option bit The SFTOPT bit is set and cleared by software.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: SFT timer starts when TXSOM is set by software.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: SFT timer starts automatically at the end of message transmission/reception.

BitField.name: OAR
BitField.description: Own addresses configuration The OAR bits are set by software to select which destination logical addresses has to be considered in receive mode. Each bit, when set, enables the CEC logical address identified by the given bit position. At the end of HEADER reception, the received destination address is compared with the enabled addresses. In case of matching address, the incoming message is acknowledged and received. In case of non-matching address, the incoming message is received only in listen mode (LSTN = 1), but without acknowledge sent. Broadcast messages are always received. Example: OAR = 0b000 0000 0010 0001 means that CEC acknowledges addresses 0x0 and 0x5. Consequently, each message directed to one of these addresses is received.

BitField.name: LSTN
BitField.description: Listen mode LSTN bit is set and cleared by software.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: CEC peripheral receives only message addressed to its own address (OAR). Messages addressed to different destination are ignored. Broadcast messages are always received.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: CEC peripheral receives messages addressed to its own address (OAR) with positive acknowledge. Messages addressed to different destination are received, but without interfering with the CEC bus: no acknowledge sent.

BitField.name: TXD
BitField.description: Tx Data register. TXD is a write-only register containing the data byte to be transmitted. Note: TXD must be written when TXSTART=1

BitField.name: RXD
BitField.description: Rx Data register. RXD is read-only and contains the last data byte which has been received from the CEC line.

BitField.name: RXBR
BitField.description: Rx-Byte Received The RXBR bit is set by hardware to inform application that a new byte has been received from the CEC line and stored into the RXD buffer. RXBR is cleared by software write at 1.

BitField.name: RXEND
BitField.description: End Of Reception RXEND is set by hardware to inform application that the last byte of a CEC message is received from the CEC line and stored into the RXD buffer. RXEND is set at the same time of RXBR. RXEND is cleared by software write at 1.

BitField.name: RXOVR
BitField.description: Rx-Overrun RXOVR is set by hardware if RXBR is not yet cleared at the time a new byte is received on the CEC line and stored into RXD. RXOVR assertion stops message reception so that no acknowledge is sent. In case of broadcast, a negative acknowledge is sent. RXOVR is cleared by software write at 1.

BitField.name: BRE
BitField.description: Rx-Bit Rising Error BRE is set by hardware in case a Data-Bit waveform is detected with Bit Rising Error. BRE is set either at the time the misplaced rising edge occurs, or at the end of the maximum BRE tolerance allowed by RXTOL, in case rising edge is still longing. BRE stops message reception if BRESTP=1. BRE generates an Error-Bit on the CEC line if BREGEN=1. BRE is cleared by software write at 1.

BitField.name: SBPE
BitField.description: Rx-Short Bit Period Error SBPE is set by hardware in case a Data-Bit waveform is detected with Short Bit Period Error. SBPE is set at the time the anticipated falling edge occurs. SBPE generates an Error-Bit on the CEC line. SBPE is cleared by software write at 1.

BitField.name: LBPE
BitField.description: Rx-Long Bit Period Error LBPE is set by hardware in case a Data-Bit waveform is detected with Long Bit Period Error. LBPE is set at the end of the maximum bit-extension tolerance allowed by RXTOL, in case falling edge is still longing. LBPE always stops reception of the CEC message. LBPE generates an Error-Bit on the CEC line if LBPEGEN=1. In case of broadcast, Error-Bit is generated even in case of LBPEGEN=0. LBPE is cleared by software write at 1.

BitField.name: RXACKE
BitField.description: Rx-Missing Acknowledge In receive mode, RXACKE is set by hardware to inform application that no acknowledge was seen on the CEC line. RXACKE applies only for broadcast messages and in listen mode also for not directly addressed messages (destination address not enabled in OAR). RXACKE aborts message reception. RXACKE is cleared by software write at 1.

BitField.name: ARBLST
BitField.description: Arbitration Lost ARBLST is set by hardware to inform application that CEC device is switching to reception due to arbitration lost event following the TXSOM command. ARBLST can be due either to a contending CEC device starting earlier or starting at the same time but with higher HEADER priority. After ARBLST assertion TXSOM bit keeps pending for next transmission attempt. ARBLST is cleared by software write at 1.

BitField.name: TXBR
BitField.description: Tx-Byte Request TXBR is set by hardware to inform application that the next transmission data has to be written to TXDR. TXBR is set when the 4th bit of currently transmitted byte is sent. Application must write the next byte to TXDR within 6 nominal data-bit periods before transmission underrun error occurs (TXUDR). TXBR is cleared by software write at 1.

BitField.name: TXEND
BitField.description: End of Transmission TXEND is set by hardware to inform application that the last byte of the CEC message has been successfully transmitted. TXEND clears the TXSOM and TXEOM control bits. TXEND is cleared by software write at 1.

BitField.name: TXUDR
BitField.description: Tx-Buffer Underrun In transmission mode, TXUDR is set by hardware if application was not in time to load TXDR before of next byte transmission. TXUDR aborts message transmission and clears TXSOM and TXEOM control bits. TXUDR is cleared by software write at 1

BitField.name: TXERR
BitField.description: Tx-Error In transmission mode, TXERR is set by hardware if the CEC initiator detects low impedance on the CEC line while it is released. TXERR aborts message transmission and clears TXSOM and TXEOM controls. TXERR is cleared by software write at 1.

BitField.name: TXACKE
BitField.description: Tx-Missing Acknowledge Error In transmission mode, TXACKE is set by hardware to inform application that no acknowledge was received. In case of broadcast transmission, TXACKE informs application that a negative acknowledge was received. TXACKE aborts message transmission and clears TXSOM and TXEOM controls. TXACKE is cleared by software write at 1.

BitField.name: RXBRIE
BitField.description: Rx-byte received interrupt enable The RXBRIE bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: RXENDIE
BitField.description: End of reception interrupt enable The RXENDIE bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: RXOVRIE
BitField.description: Rx-buffer overrun interrupt enable The RXOVRIE bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: BREIE
BitField.description: Bit rising error interrupt enable The BREIE bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: SBPEIE
BitField.description: Short bit period error interrupt enable The SBPEIE bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: LBPEIE
BitField.description: Long bit period error interrupt enable The LBPEIE bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: RXACKIE
BitField.description: Rx-missing acknowledge error interrupt enable The RXACKIE bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: ARBLSTIE
BitField.description: Arbitration lost interrupt enable The ARBLSTIE bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: TXBRIE
BitField.description: Tx-byte request interrupt enable The TXBRIE bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: TXENDIE
BitField.description: Tx-end of message interrupt enable The TXENDIE bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: TXUDRIE
BitField.description: Tx-underrun interrupt enable The TXUDRIE bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: TXERRIE
BitField.description: Tx-error interrupt enable The TXERRIE bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: TXACKIE
BitField.description: Tx-missing acknowledge error interrupt enable The TXACKEIE bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: PE
BitField.description: Peripheral enable Note: When PE=0, the I2C SCL and SDA lines are released. Internal state machines and status bits are put back to their reset value. When cleared, PE must be kept low for at least 3 APB clock cycles.

BitField.name: TXIE
BitField.description: TX Interrupt enable

BitField.name: RXIE
BitField.description: RX Interrupt enable

BitField.name: ADDRIE
BitField.description: Address match Interrupt enable (slave only)

BitField.name: NACKIE
BitField.description: Not acknowledge received Interrupt enable

BitField.name: STOPIE
BitField.description: Stop detection Interrupt enable

BitField.name: TCIE
BitField.description: Transfer Complete interrupt enable Note: Any of these events generate an interrupt: Transfer Complete (TC) Transfer Complete Reload (TCR)

BitField.name: ERRIE
BitField.description: Error interrupts enable Note: Any of these errors generate an interrupt: Arbitration Loss (ARLO) Bus Error detection (BERR) Overrun/Underrun (OVR) Timeout detection (TIMEOUT) PEC error detection (PECERR) Alert pin event detection (ALERT)

BitField.name: DNF
BitField.description: Digital noise filter These bits are used to configure the digital noise filter on SDA and SCL input. The digital filter, filters spikes with a length of up to DNF[3:0] * tI2CCLK ... Note: If the analog filter is also enabled, the digital filter is added to the analog filter. This filter can only be programmed when the I2C is disabled (PE = 0).

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Digital filter enabled and filtering capability up to 1 tI2CCLK

Enum.name: B_0xF
Enum.description: digital filter enabled and filtering capability up to15 tI2CCLK

BitField.name: ANFOFF
BitField.description: Analog noise filter OFF Note: This bit can only be programmed when the I2C is disabled (PE = 0).

BitField.name: TXDMAEN
BitField.description: DMA transmission requests enable

BitField.name: RXDMAEN
BitField.description: DMA reception requests enable

BitField.name: SBC
BitField.description: Slave byte control This bit is used to enable hardware byte control in slave mode.

BitField.name: NOSTRETCH
BitField.description: Clock stretching disable This bit is used to disable clock stretching in slave mode. It must be kept cleared in master mode. Note: This bit can only be programmed when the I2C is disabled (PE = 0).

BitField.name: WUPEN
BitField.description: Wakeup from Stop mode enable Note: If the Wakeup from Stop mode feature is not supported, this bit is reserved and forced by hardware to '0â. Refer to . Note: WUPEN can be set only when DNF = '0000â

BitField.name: GCEN
BitField.description: General call enable

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: General call disabled. Address 0b00000000 is NACKed.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: General call enabled. Address 0b00000000 is ACKed.

BitField.name: SMBHEN
BitField.description: SMBus Host Address enable Note: If the SMBus feature is not supported, this bit is reserved and forced by hardware to '0â. Refer to .

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Host Address disabled. Address 0b0001000x is NACKed.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Host Address enabled. Address 0b0001000x is ACKed.

BitField.name: SMBDEN
BitField.description: SMBus Device Default Address enable Note: If the SMBus feature is not supported, this bit is reserved and forced by hardware to '0â. Refer to .

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Device Default Address disabled. Address 0b1100001x is NACKed.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Device Default Address enabled. Address 0b1100001x is ACKed.

BitField.name: ALERTEN
BitField.description: SMBus alert enable Note: When ALERTEN=0, the SMBA pin can be used as a standard GPIO. If the SMBus feature is not supported, this bit is reserved and forced by hardware to '0â. Refer to .

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The SMBus alert pin (SMBA) is not supported in host mode (SMBHEN=1). In device mode (SMBHEN=0), the SMBA pin is released and the Alert Response Address header is disabled (0001100x followed by NACK).

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The SMBus alert pin is supported in host mode (SMBHEN=1). In device mode (SMBHEN=0), the SMBA pin is driven low and the Alert Response Address header is enabled (0001100x followed by ACK).

BitField.name: PECEN
BitField.description: PEC enable Note: If the SMBus feature is not supported, this bit is reserved and forced by hardware to '0â. Refer to .

BitField.name: SADD
BitField.description: Slave address (master mode) In 7-bit addressing mode (ADD10 = 0): SADD[7:1] should be written with the 7-bit slave address to be sent. The bits SADD[9], SADD[8] and SADD[0] are don't care. In 10-bit addressing mode (ADD10 = 1): SADD[9:0] should be written with the 10-bit slave address to be sent. Note: Changing these bits when the START bit is set is not allowed.

BitField.name: RD_WRN
BitField.description: Transfer direction (master mode) Note: Changing this bit when the START bit is set is not allowed.

BitField.name: ADD10
BitField.description: 10-bit addressing mode (master mode) Note: Changing this bit when the START bit is set is not allowed.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The master operates in 7-bit addressing mode,

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The master operates in 10-bit addressing mode

BitField.name: HEAD10R
BitField.description: 10-bit address header only read direction (master receiver mode) Note: Changing this bit when the START bit is set is not allowed.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The master sends the complete 10 bit slave address read sequence: Start + 2 bytes 10bit address in write direction + Restart + 1st 7 bits of the 10 bit address in read direction.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The master only sends the 1st 7 bits of the 10 bit address, followed by Read direction.

BitField.name: START
BitField.description: Start generation This bit is set by software, and cleared by hardware after the Start followed by the address sequence is sent, by an arbitration loss, by a timeout error detection, or when PE = 0. It can also be cleared by software by writing '1â to the ADDRCF bit in the I2C_ICR register. If the I2C is already in master mode with AUTOEND = 0, setting this bit generates a Repeated Start condition when RELOAD=0, after the end of the NBYTES transfer. Otherwise setting this bit generates a START condition once the bus is free. Note: Writing '0â to this bit has no effect. The START bit can be set even if the bus is BUSY or I2C is in slave mode. This bit has no effect when RELOAD is set.

BitField.name: STOP
BitField.description: Stop generation (master mode) The bit is set by software, cleared by hardware when a STOP condition is detected, or when PE = 0. In Master Mode: Note: Writing '0â to this bit has no effect.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Stop generation after current byte transfer.

BitField.name: NACK
BitField.description: NACK generation (slave mode) The bit is set by software, cleared by hardware when the NACK is sent, or when a STOP condition or an Address matched is received, or when PE=0. Note: Writing '0â to this bit has no effect. This bit is used in slave mode only: in master receiver mode, NACK is automatically generated after last byte preceding STOP or RESTART condition, whatever the NACK bit value. When an overrun occurs in slave receiver NOSTRETCH mode, a NACK is automatically generated whatever the NACK bit value. When hardware PEC checking is enabled (PECBYTE=1), the PEC acknowledge value does not depend on the NACK value.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: an ACK is sent after current received byte.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: a NACK is sent after current received byte.

BitField.name: NBYTES
BitField.description: Number of bytes The number of bytes to be transmitted/received is programmed there. This field is donât care in slave mode with SBC=0. Note: Changing these bits when the START bit is set is not allowed.

BitField.name: RELOAD
BitField.description: NBYTES reload mode This bit is set and cleared by software.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The transfer is completed after the NBYTES data transfer (STOP or RESTART follows).

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The transfer is not completed after the NBYTES data transfer (NBYTES is reloaded). TCR flag is set when NBYTES data are transferred, stretching SCL low.

BitField.name: AUTOEND
BitField.description: Automatic end mode (master mode) This bit is set and cleared by software. Note: This bit has no effect in slave mode or when the RELOAD bit is set.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: software end mode: TC flag is set when NBYTES data are transferred, stretching SCL low.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Automatic end mode: a STOP condition is automatically sent when NBYTES data are transferred.

BitField.name: PECBYTE
BitField.description: Packet error checking byte This bit is set by software, and cleared by hardware when the PEC is transferred, or when a STOP condition or an Address matched is received, also when PE=0. Note: Writing '0â to this bit has no effect. This bit has no effect when RELOAD is set. This bit has no effect is slave mode when SBC=0. If the SMBus feature is not supported, this bit is reserved and forced by hardware to '0â. Refer to .

BitField.name: OA1
BitField.description: Interface own slave address 7-bit addressing mode: OA1[7:1] contains the 7-bit own slave address. The bits OA1[9], OA1[8] and OA1[0] are don't care. 10-bit addressing mode: OA1[9:0] contains the 10-bit own slave address. Note: These bits can be written only when OA1EN=0.

BitField.name: OA1MODE
BitField.description: Own Address 1 10-bit mode Note: This bit can be written only when OA1EN=0.

BitField.name: OA1EN
BitField.description: Own Address 1 enable

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Own address 1 disabled. The received slave address OA1 is NACKed.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Own address 1 enabled. The received slave address OA1 is ACKed.

BitField.name: OA2
BitField.description: Interface address 7-bit addressing mode: 7-bit address Note: These bits can be written only when OA2EN=0.

BitField.name: OA2MSK
BitField.description: Own Address 2 masks Note: These bits can be written only when OA2EN=0. As soon as OA2MSK is not equal to 0, the reserved I2C addresses (0b0000xxx and 0b1111xxx) are not acknowledged even if the comparison matches.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: OA2[1] is masked and donât care. Only OA2[7:2] are compared.

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: OA2[2:1] are masked and donât care. Only OA2[7:3] are compared.

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: OA2[3:1] are masked and donât care. Only OA2[7:4] are compared.

Enum.name: B_0x4
Enum.description: OA2[4:1] are masked and donât care. Only OA2[7:5] are compared.

Enum.name: B_0x5
Enum.description: OA2[5:1] are masked and donât care. Only OA2[7:6] are compared.

Enum.name: B_0x6
Enum.description: OA2[6:1] are masked and donât care. Only OA2[7] is compared.

Enum.name: B_0x7
Enum.description: OA2[7:1] are masked and donât care. No comparison is done, and all (except reserved) 7-bit received addresses are acknowledged.

BitField.name: OA2EN
BitField.description: Own Address 2 enable

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Own address 2 disabled. The received slave address OA2 is NACKed.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Own address 2 enabled. The received slave address OA2 is ACKed.

BitField.name: SCLL
BitField.description: SCL low period (master mode)

BitField.name: SCLH
BitField.description: SCL high period (master mode)

BitField.name: SDADEL
BitField.description: Data hold time

BitField.name: SCLDEL
BitField.description: Data setup time

BitField.name: PRESC
BitField.description: Timing prescaler

BitField.name: TIMEOUTA
BitField.description: Bus Timeout A This field is used to configure: The SCL low timeout condition tTIMEOUT when TIDLE=0 tTIMEOUT= (TIMEOUTA+1) x 2048 x tI2CCLK The bus idle condition (both SCL and SDA high) when TIDLE=1 tIDLE= (TIMEOUTA+1) x 4 x tI2CCLK Note: These bits can be written only when TIMOUTEN=0.

BitField.name: TIDLE
BitField.description: Idle clock timeout detection Note: This bit can be written only when TIMOUTEN=0.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: TIMEOUTA is used to detect SCL low timeout

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: TIMEOUTA is used to detect both SCL and SDA high timeout (bus idle condition)

BitField.name: TIMOUTEN
BitField.description: Clock timeout enable

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: SCL timeout detection is enabled: when SCL is low for more than tTIMEOUT (TIDLE=0) or high for more than tIDLE (TIDLE=1), a timeout error is detected (TIMEOUT=1).

BitField.name: TIMEOUTB
BitField.description: Bus timeout B This field is used to configure the cumulative clock extension timeout: In master mode, the master cumulative clock low extend time (tLOW:MEXT) is detected In slave mode, the slave cumulative clock low extend time (tLOW:SEXT) is detected tLOW:EXT= (TIMEOUTB+1) x 2048 x tI2CCLK Note: These bits can be written only when TEXTEN=0.

BitField.name: TEXTEN
BitField.description: Extended clock timeout enable

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Extended clock timeout detection is disabled

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Extended clock timeout detection is enabled. When a cumulative SCL stretch for more than tLOW:EXT is done by the I2C interface, a timeout error is detected (TIMEOUT=1).

BitField.name: ADDCODE
BitField.description: Address match code (Slave mode)

BitField.name: DIR
BitField.description: Transfer direction (Slave mode) This flag is updated when an address match event occurs (ADDR=1).

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Write transfer, slave enters receiver mode.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Read transfer, slave enters transmitter mode.

BitField.name: BUSY
BitField.description: Bus busy

BitField.name: ALERT
BitField.description: SMBus alert

BitField.name: TIMEOUT
BitField.description: Timeout or t_low detection flag

BitField.name: PECERR
BitField.description: PEC Error in reception

BitField.name: OVR
BitField.description: Overrun/Underrun (slave mode)

BitField.name: ARLO
BitField.description: Arbitration lost

BitField.name: BERR
BitField.description: Bus error

BitField.name: TCR
BitField.description: Transfer Complete Reload

BitField.name: TC
BitField.description: Transfer Complete (master mode)

BitField.name: STOPF
BitField.description: Stop detection flag

BitField.name: NACKF
BitField.description: Not acknowledge received flag

BitField.name: ADDR
BitField.description: Address matched (slave mode)

BitField.name: RXNE
BitField.description: Receive data register not empty (receivers)

BitField.name: TXIS
BitField.description: Transmit interrupt status (transmitters)

BitField.name: TXE
BitField.description: Transmit data register empty (transmitters)

BitField.name: ALERTCF
BitField.description: Alert flag clear

BitField.name: TIMOUTCF
BitField.description: Timeout detection flag clear

BitField.name: PECCF
BitField.description: PEC Error flag clear

BitField.name: OVRCF
BitField.description: Overrun/Underrun flag clear

BitField.name: ARLOCF
BitField.description: Arbitration lost flag clear

BitField.name: BERRCF
BitField.description: Bus error flag clear

BitField.name: STOPCF
BitField.description: Stop detection flag clear

BitField.name: NACKCF
BitField.description: Not Acknowledge flag clear

BitField.name: ADDRCF
BitField.description: Address Matched flag clear

BitField.name: PEC
BitField.description: Packet error checking register

BitField.name: RXDATA
BitField.description: 8-bit receive data

BitField.name: TXDATA
BitField.description: 8-bit transmit data

BitField.name: PE
BitField.description: Peripheral enable Note: When PE=0, the I2C SCL and SDA lines are released. Internal state machines and status bits are put back to their reset value. When cleared, PE must be kept low for at least 3 APB clock cycles.

BitField.name: TXIE
BitField.description: TX Interrupt enable

BitField.name: RXIE
BitField.description: RX Interrupt enable

BitField.name: ADDRIE
BitField.description: Address match Interrupt enable (slave only)

BitField.name: NACKIE
BitField.description: Not acknowledge received Interrupt enable

BitField.name: STOPIE
BitField.description: Stop detection Interrupt enable

BitField.name: TCIE
BitField.description: Transfer Complete interrupt enable Note: Any of these events generate an interrupt: Transfer Complete (TC) Transfer Complete Reload (TCR)

BitField.name: ERRIE
BitField.description: Error interrupts enable Note: Any of these errors generate an interrupt: Arbitration Loss (ARLO) Bus Error detection (BERR) Overrun/Underrun (OVR) Timeout detection (TIMEOUT) PEC error detection (PECERR) Alert pin event detection (ALERT)

BitField.name: DNF
BitField.description: Digital noise filter These bits are used to configure the digital noise filter on SDA and SCL input. The digital filter, filters spikes with a length of up to DNF[3:0] * tI2CCLK ... Note: If the analog filter is also enabled, the digital filter is added to the analog filter. This filter can only be programmed when the I2C is disabled (PE = 0).

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Digital filter enabled and filtering capability up to 1 tI2CCLK

Enum.name: B_0xF
Enum.description: digital filter enabled and filtering capability up to15 tI2CCLK

BitField.name: ANFOFF
BitField.description: Analog noise filter OFF Note: This bit can only be programmed when the I2C is disabled (PE = 0).

BitField.name: TXDMAEN
BitField.description: DMA transmission requests enable

BitField.name: RXDMAEN
BitField.description: DMA reception requests enable

BitField.name: SBC
BitField.description: Slave byte control This bit is used to enable hardware byte control in slave mode.

BitField.name: NOSTRETCH
BitField.description: Clock stretching disable This bit is used to disable clock stretching in slave mode. It must be kept cleared in master mode. Note: This bit can only be programmed when the I2C is disabled (PE = 0).

BitField.name: WUPEN
BitField.description: Wakeup from Stop mode enable Note: If the Wakeup from Stop mode feature is not supported, this bit is reserved and forced by hardware to '0â. Refer to . Note: WUPEN can be set only when DNF = '0000â

BitField.name: GCEN
BitField.description: General call enable

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: General call disabled. Address 0b00000000 is NACKed.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: General call enabled. Address 0b00000000 is ACKed.

BitField.name: SMBHEN
BitField.description: SMBus Host Address enable Note: If the SMBus feature is not supported, this bit is reserved and forced by hardware to '0â. Refer to .

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Host Address disabled. Address 0b0001000x is NACKed.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Host Address enabled. Address 0b0001000x is ACKed.

BitField.name: SMBDEN
BitField.description: SMBus Device Default Address enable Note: If the SMBus feature is not supported, this bit is reserved and forced by hardware to '0â. Refer to .

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Device Default Address disabled. Address 0b1100001x is NACKed.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Device Default Address enabled. Address 0b1100001x is ACKed.

BitField.name: ALERTEN
BitField.description: SMBus alert enable Note: When ALERTEN=0, the SMBA pin can be used as a standard GPIO. If the SMBus feature is not supported, this bit is reserved and forced by hardware to '0â. Refer to .

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The SMBus alert pin (SMBA) is not supported in host mode (SMBHEN=1). In device mode (SMBHEN=0), the SMBA pin is released and the Alert Response Address header is disabled (0001100x followed by NACK).

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The SMBus alert pin is supported in host mode (SMBHEN=1). In device mode (SMBHEN=0), the SMBA pin is driven low and the Alert Response Address header is enabled (0001100x followed by ACK).

BitField.name: PECEN
BitField.description: PEC enable Note: If the SMBus feature is not supported, this bit is reserved and forced by hardware to '0â. Refer to .

BitField.name: SADD
BitField.description: Slave address (master mode) In 7-bit addressing mode (ADD10 = 0): SADD[7:1] should be written with the 7-bit slave address to be sent. The bits SADD[9], SADD[8] and SADD[0] are don't care. In 10-bit addressing mode (ADD10 = 1): SADD[9:0] should be written with the 10-bit slave address to be sent. Note: Changing these bits when the START bit is set is not allowed.

BitField.name: RD_WRN
BitField.description: Transfer direction (master mode) Note: Changing this bit when the START bit is set is not allowed.

BitField.name: ADD10
BitField.description: 10-bit addressing mode (master mode) Note: Changing this bit when the START bit is set is not allowed.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The master operates in 7-bit addressing mode,

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The master operates in 10-bit addressing mode

BitField.name: HEAD10R
BitField.description: 10-bit address header only read direction (master receiver mode) Note: Changing this bit when the START bit is set is not allowed.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The master sends the complete 10 bit slave address read sequence: Start + 2 bytes 10bit address in write direction + Restart + 1st 7 bits of the 10 bit address in read direction.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The master only sends the 1st 7 bits of the 10 bit address, followed by Read direction.

BitField.name: START
BitField.description: Start generation This bit is set by software, and cleared by hardware after the Start followed by the address sequence is sent, by an arbitration loss, by a timeout error detection, or when PE = 0. It can also be cleared by software by writing '1â to the ADDRCF bit in the I2C_ICR register. If the I2C is already in master mode with AUTOEND = 0, setting this bit generates a Repeated Start condition when RELOAD=0, after the end of the NBYTES transfer. Otherwise setting this bit generates a START condition once the bus is free. Note: Writing '0â to this bit has no effect. The START bit can be set even if the bus is BUSY or I2C is in slave mode. This bit has no effect when RELOAD is set.

BitField.name: STOP
BitField.description: Stop generation (master mode) The bit is set by software, cleared by hardware when a STOP condition is detected, or when PE = 0. In Master Mode: Note: Writing '0â to this bit has no effect.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Stop generation after current byte transfer.

BitField.name: NACK
BitField.description: NACK generation (slave mode) The bit is set by software, cleared by hardware when the NACK is sent, or when a STOP condition or an Address matched is received, or when PE=0. Note: Writing '0â to this bit has no effect. This bit is used in slave mode only: in master receiver mode, NACK is automatically generated after last byte preceding STOP or RESTART condition, whatever the NACK bit value. When an overrun occurs in slave receiver NOSTRETCH mode, a NACK is automatically generated whatever the NACK bit value. When hardware PEC checking is enabled (PECBYTE=1), the PEC acknowledge value does not depend on the NACK value.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: an ACK is sent after current received byte.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: a NACK is sent after current received byte.

BitField.name: NBYTES
BitField.description: Number of bytes The number of bytes to be transmitted/received is programmed there. This field is donât care in slave mode with SBC=0. Note: Changing these bits when the START bit is set is not allowed.

BitField.name: RELOAD
BitField.description: NBYTES reload mode This bit is set and cleared by software.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The transfer is completed after the NBYTES data transfer (STOP or RESTART follows).

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The transfer is not completed after the NBYTES data transfer (NBYTES is reloaded). TCR flag is set when NBYTES data are transferred, stretching SCL low.

BitField.name: AUTOEND
BitField.description: Automatic end mode (master mode) This bit is set and cleared by software. Note: This bit has no effect in slave mode or when the RELOAD bit is set.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: software end mode: TC flag is set when NBYTES data are transferred, stretching SCL low.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Automatic end mode: a STOP condition is automatically sent when NBYTES data are transferred.

BitField.name: PECBYTE
BitField.description: Packet error checking byte This bit is set by software, and cleared by hardware when the PEC is transferred, or when a STOP condition or an Address matched is received, also when PE=0. Note: Writing '0â to this bit has no effect. This bit has no effect when RELOAD is set. This bit has no effect is slave mode when SBC=0. If the SMBus feature is not supported, this bit is reserved and forced by hardware to '0â. Refer to .

BitField.name: OA1
BitField.description: Interface own slave address 7-bit addressing mode: OA1[7:1] contains the 7-bit own slave address. The bits OA1[9], OA1[8] and OA1[0] are don't care. 10-bit addressing mode: OA1[9:0] contains the 10-bit own slave address. Note: These bits can be written only when OA1EN=0.

BitField.name: OA1MODE
BitField.description: Own Address 1 10-bit mode Note: This bit can be written only when OA1EN=0.

BitField.name: OA1EN
BitField.description: Own Address 1 enable

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Own address 1 disabled. The received slave address OA1 is NACKed.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Own address 1 enabled. The received slave address OA1 is ACKed.

BitField.name: OA2
BitField.description: Interface address 7-bit addressing mode: 7-bit address Note: These bits can be written only when OA2EN=0.

BitField.name: OA2MSK
BitField.description: Own Address 2 masks Note: These bits can be written only when OA2EN=0. As soon as OA2MSK is not equal to 0, the reserved I2C addresses (0b0000xxx and 0b1111xxx) are not acknowledged even if the comparison matches.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: OA2[1] is masked and donât care. Only OA2[7:2] are compared.

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: OA2[2:1] are masked and donât care. Only OA2[7:3] are compared.

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: OA2[3:1] are masked and donât care. Only OA2[7:4] are compared.

Enum.name: B_0x4
Enum.description: OA2[4:1] are masked and donât care. Only OA2[7:5] are compared.

Enum.name: B_0x5
Enum.description: OA2[5:1] are masked and donât care. Only OA2[7:6] are compared.

Enum.name: B_0x6
Enum.description: OA2[6:1] are masked and donât care. Only OA2[7] is compared.

Enum.name: B_0x7
Enum.description: OA2[7:1] are masked and donât care. No comparison is done, and all (except reserved) 7-bit received addresses are acknowledged.

BitField.name: OA2EN
BitField.description: Own Address 2 enable

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Own address 2 disabled. The received slave address OA2 is NACKed.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Own address 2 enabled. The received slave address OA2 is ACKed.

BitField.name: SCLL
BitField.description: SCL low period (master mode)

BitField.name: SCLH
BitField.description: SCL high period (master mode)

BitField.name: SDADEL
BitField.description: Data hold time

BitField.name: SCLDEL
BitField.description: Data setup time

BitField.name: PRESC
BitField.description: Timing prescaler

BitField.name: TIMEOUTA
BitField.description: Bus Timeout A This field is used to configure: The SCL low timeout condition tTIMEOUT when TIDLE=0 tTIMEOUT= (TIMEOUTA+1) x 2048 x tI2CCLK The bus idle condition (both SCL and SDA high) when TIDLE=1 tIDLE= (TIMEOUTA+1) x 4 x tI2CCLK Note: These bits can be written only when TIMOUTEN=0.

BitField.name: TIDLE
BitField.description: Idle clock timeout detection Note: This bit can be written only when TIMOUTEN=0.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: TIMEOUTA is used to detect SCL low timeout

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: TIMEOUTA is used to detect both SCL and SDA high timeout (bus idle condition)

BitField.name: TIMOUTEN
BitField.description: Clock timeout enable

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: SCL timeout detection is enabled: when SCL is low for more than tTIMEOUT (TIDLE=0) or high for more than tIDLE (TIDLE=1), a timeout error is detected (TIMEOUT=1).

BitField.name: TIMEOUTB
BitField.description: Bus timeout B This field is used to configure the cumulative clock extension timeout: In master mode, the master cumulative clock low extend time (tLOW:MEXT) is detected In slave mode, the slave cumulative clock low extend time (tLOW:SEXT) is detected tLOW:EXT= (TIMEOUTB+1) x 2048 x tI2CCLK Note: These bits can be written only when TEXTEN=0.

BitField.name: TEXTEN
BitField.description: Extended clock timeout enable

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Extended clock timeout detection is disabled

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Extended clock timeout detection is enabled. When a cumulative SCL stretch for more than tLOW:EXT is done by the I2C interface, a timeout error is detected (TIMEOUT=1).

BitField.name: ADDCODE
BitField.description: Address match code (Slave mode)

BitField.name: DIR
BitField.description: Transfer direction (Slave mode) This flag is updated when an address match event occurs (ADDR=1).

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Write transfer, slave enters receiver mode.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Read transfer, slave enters transmitter mode.

BitField.name: BUSY
BitField.description: Bus busy

BitField.name: TXIS
BitField.description: Transmit interrupt status (transmitters)

BitField.description: Transmit data register empty (transmitters)

BitField.name: ALERTCF
BitField.description: Alert flag clear

BitField.name: TIMOUTCF
BitField.description: Timeout detection flag clear

BitField.name: PECCF
BitField.description: PEC Error flag clear

BitField.name: OVRCF
BitField.description: Overrun/Underrun flag clear

BitField.name: ARLOCF
BitField.description: Arbitration lost flag clear

BitField.name: BERRCF
BitField.description: Bus error flag clear

BitField.name: STOPCF
BitField.description: Stop detection flag clear

BitField.name: NACKCF
BitField.description: Not Acknowledge flag clear

BitField.name: ADDRCF
BitField.description: Address Matched flag clear

BitField.name: PEC
BitField.description: Packet error checking register

BitField.name: RXDATA
BitField.description: 8-bit receive data

BitField.name: TXDATA
BitField.description: 8-bit transmit data

BitField.name: PE
BitField.description: Peripheral enable Note: When PE=0, the I2C SCL and SDA lines are released. Internal state machines and status bits are put back to their reset value. When cleared, PE must be kept low for at least 3 APB clock cycles.

BitField.name: TXIE
BitField.description: TX Interrupt enable

BitField.name: RXIE
BitField.description: RX Interrupt enable

BitField.name: ADDRIE
BitField.description: Address match Interrupt enable (slave only)

BitField.name: NACKIE
BitField.description: Not acknowledge received Interrupt enable

BitField.name: STOPIE
BitField.description: Stop detection Interrupt enable

BitField.name: TCIE
BitField.description: Transfer Complete interrupt enable Note: Any of these events generate an interrupt: Transfer Complete (TC) Transfer Complete Reload (TCR)

BitField.name: ERRIE
BitField.description: Error interrupts enable Note: Any of these errors generate an interrupt: Arbitration Loss (ARLO) Bus Error detection (BERR) Overrun/Underrun (OVR) Timeout detection (TIMEOUT) PEC error detection (PECERR) Alert pin event detection (ALERT)

BitField.name: DNF
BitField.description: Digital noise filter These bits are used to configure the digital noise filter on SDA and SCL input. The digital filter, filters spikes with a length of up to DNF[3:0] * tI2CCLK ... Note: If the analog filter is also enabled, the digital filter is added to the analog filter. This filter can only be programmed when the I2C is disabled (PE = 0).

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Digital filter enabled and filtering capability up to 1 tI2CCLK

Enum.name: B_0xF
Enum.description: digital filter enabled and filtering capability up to15 tI2CCLK

BitField.name: ANFOFF
BitField.description: Analog noise filter OFF Note: This bit can only be programmed when the I2C is disabled (PE = 0).

BitField.name: TXDMAEN
BitField.description: DMA transmission requests enable

BitField.name: RXDMAEN
BitField.description: DMA reception requests enable

BitField.name: SBC
BitField.description: Slave byte control This bit is used to enable hardware byte control in slave mode.

BitField.name: NOSTRETCH
BitField.description: Clock stretching disable This bit is used to disable clock stretching in slave mode. It must be kept cleared in master mode. Note: This bit can only be programmed when the I2C is disabled (PE = 0).

BitField.name: WUPEN
BitField.description: Wakeup from Stop mode enable Note: If the Wakeup from Stop mode feature is not supported, this bit is reserved and forced by hardware to '0â. Refer to . Note: WUPEN can be set only when DNF = '0000â

BitField.name: GCEN
BitField.description: General call enable

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: General call disabled. Address 0b00000000 is NACKed.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: General call enabled. Address 0b00000000 is ACKed.

BitField.name: SMBHEN
BitField.description: SMBus Host Address enable Note: If the SMBus feature is not supported, this bit is reserved and forced by hardware to '0â. Refer to .

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Host Address disabled. Address 0b0001000x is NACKed.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Host Address enabled. Address 0b0001000x is ACKed.

BitField.name: SMBDEN
BitField.description: SMBus Device Default Address enable Note: If the SMBus feature is not supported, this bit is reserved and forced by hardware to '0â. Refer to .

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Device Default Address disabled. Address 0b1100001x is NACKed.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Device Default Address enabled. Address 0b1100001x is ACKed.

BitField.name: ALERTEN
BitField.description: SMBus alert enable Note: When ALERTEN=0, the SMBA pin can be used as a standard GPIO. If the SMBus feature is not supported, this bit is reserved and forced by hardware to '0â. Refer to .

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The SMBus alert pin (SMBA) is not supported in host mode (SMBHEN=1). In device mode (SMBHEN=0), the SMBA pin is released and the Alert Response Address header is disabled (0001100x followed by NACK).

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The SMBus alert pin is supported in host mode (SMBHEN=1). In device mode (SMBHEN=0), the SMBA pin is driven low and the Alert Response Address header is enabled (0001100x followed by ACK).

BitField.name: PECEN
BitField.description: PEC enable Note: If the SMBus feature is not supported, this bit is reserved and forced by hardware to '0â. Refer to .

BitField.name: SADD
BitField.description: Slave address (master mode) In 7-bit addressing mode (ADD10 = 0): SADD[7:1] should be written with the 7-bit slave address to be sent. The bits SADD[9], SADD[8] and SADD[0] are don't care. In 10-bit addressing mode (ADD10 = 1): SADD[9:0] should be written with the 10-bit slave address to be sent. Note: Changing these bits when the START bit is set is not allowed.

BitField.name: RD_WRN
BitField.description: Transfer direction (master mode) Note: Changing this bit when the START bit is set is not allowed.

BitField.name: ADD10
BitField.description: 10-bit addressing mode (master mode) Note: Changing this bit when the START bit is set is not allowed.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The master operates in 7-bit addressing mode,

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The master operates in 10-bit addressing mode

BitField.name: HEAD10R
BitField.description: 10-bit address header only read direction (master receiver mode) Note: Changing this bit when the START bit is set is not allowed.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The master sends the complete 10 bit slave address read sequence: Start + 2 bytes 10bit address in write direction + Restart + 1st 7 bits of the 10 bit address in read direction.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The master only sends the 1st 7 bits of the 10 bit address, followed by Read direction.

BitField.name: START
BitField.description: Start generation This bit is set by software, and cleared by hardware after the Start followed by the address sequence is sent, by an arbitration loss, by a timeout error detection, or when PE = 0. It can also be cleared by software by writing '1â to the ADDRCF bit in the I2C_ICR register. If the I2C is already in master mode with AUTOEND = 0, setting this bit generates a Repeated Start condition when RELOAD=0, after the end of the NBYTES transfer. Otherwise setting this bit generates a START condition once the bus is free. Note: Writing '0â to this bit has no effect. The START bit can be set even if the bus is BUSY or I2C is in slave mode. This bit has no effect when RELOAD is set.

BitField.name: STOP
BitField.description: Stop generation (master mode) The bit is set by software, cleared by hardware when a STOP condition is detected, or when PE = 0. In Master Mode: Note: Writing '0â to this bit has no effect.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Stop generation after current byte transfer.

BitField.name: NACK
BitField.description: NACK generation (slave mode) The bit is set by software, cleared by hardware when the NACK is sent, or when a STOP condition or an Address matched is received, or when PE=0. Note: Writing '0â to this bit has no effect. This bit is used in slave mode only: in master receiver mode, NACK is automatically generated after last byte preceding STOP or RESTART condition, whatever the NACK bit value. When an overrun occurs in slave receiver NOSTRETCH mode, a NACK is automatically generated whatever the NACK bit value. When hardware PEC checking is enabled (PECBYTE=1), the PEC acknowledge value does not depend on the NACK value.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: an ACK is sent after current received byte.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: a NACK is sent after current received byte.

BitField.name: NBYTES
BitField.description: Number of bytes The number of bytes to be transmitted/received is programmed there. This field is donât care in slave mode with SBC=0. Note: Changing these bits when the START bit is set is not allowed.

BitField.name: RELOAD
BitField.description: NBYTES reload mode This bit is set and cleared by software.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The transfer is completed after the NBYTES data transfer (STOP or RESTART follows).

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The transfer is not completed after the NBYTES data transfer (NBYTES is reloaded). TCR flag is set when NBYTES data are transferred, stretching SCL low.

BitField.name: AUTOEND
BitField.description: Automatic end mode (master mode) This bit is set and cleared by software. Note: This bit has no effect in slave mode or when the RELOAD bit is set.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: software end mode: TC flag is set when NBYTES data are transferred, stretching SCL low.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Automatic end mode: a STOP condition is automatically sent when NBYTES data are transferred.

BitField.name: PECBYTE
BitField.description: Packet error checking byte This bit is set by software, and cleared by hardware when the PEC is transferred, or when a STOP condition or an Address matched is received, also when PE=0. Note: Writing '0â to this bit has no effect. This bit has no effect when RELOAD is set. This bit has no effect is slave mode when SBC=0. If the SMBus feature is not supported, this bit is reserved and forced by hardware to '0â. Refer to .

BitField.name: OA1
BitField.description: Interface own slave address 7-bit addressing mode: OA1[7:1] contains the 7-bit own slave address. The bits OA1[9], OA1[8] and OA1[0] are don't care. 10-bit addressing mode: OA1[9:0] contains the 10-bit own slave address. Note: These bits can be written only when OA1EN=0.

BitField.name: OA1MODE
BitField.description: Own Address 1 10-bit mode Note: This bit can be written only when OA1EN=0.

BitField.name: OA1EN
BitField.description: Own Address 1 enable

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Own address 1 disabled. The received slave address OA1 is NACKed.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Own address 1 enabled. The received slave address OA1 is ACKed.

BitField.name: OA2
BitField.description: Interface address 7-bit addressing mode: 7-bit address Note: These bits can be written only when OA2EN=0.

BitField.name: OA2MSK
BitField.description: Own Address 2 masks Note: These bits can be written only when OA2EN=0. As soon as OA2MSK is not equal to 0, the reserved I2C addresses (0b0000xxx and 0b1111xxx) are not acknowledged even if the comparison matches.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: OA2[1] is masked and donât care. Only OA2[7:2] are compared.

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: OA2[2:1] are masked and donât care. Only OA2[7:3] are compared.

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: OA2[3:1] are masked and donât care. Only OA2[7:4] are compared.

Enum.name: B_0x4
Enum.description: OA2[4:1] are masked and donât care. Only OA2[7:5] are compared.

Enum.name: B_0x5
Enum.description: OA2[5:1] are masked and donât care. Only OA2[7:6] are compared.

Enum.name: B_0x6
Enum.description: OA2[6:1] are masked and donât care. Only OA2[7] is compared.

Enum.name: B_0x7
Enum.description: OA2[7:1] are masked and donât care. No comparison is done, and all (except reserved) 7-bit received addresses are acknowledged.

BitField.name: OA2EN
BitField.description: Own Address 2 enable

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Own address 2 disabled. The received slave address OA2 is NACKed.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Own address 2 enabled. The received slave address OA2 is ACKed.

BitField.name: SCLL
BitField.description: SCL low period (master mode)

BitField.name: SCLH
BitField.description: SCL high period (master mode)

BitField.name: SDADEL
BitField.description: Data hold time

BitField.name: SCLDEL
BitField.description: Data setup time

BitField.name: PRESC
BitField.description: Timing prescaler

BitField.name: TIMEOUTA
BitField.description: Bus Timeout A This field is used to configure: The SCL low timeout condition tTIMEOUT when TIDLE=0 tTIMEOUT= (TIMEOUTA+1) x 2048 x tI2CCLK The bus idle condition (both SCL and SDA high) when TIDLE=1 tIDLE= (TIMEOUTA+1) x 4 x tI2CCLK Note: These bits can be written only when TIMOUTEN=0.

BitField.name: TIDLE
BitField.description: Idle clock timeout detection Note: This bit can be written only when TIMOUTEN=0.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: TIMEOUTA is used to detect SCL low timeout

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: TIMEOUTA is used to detect both SCL and SDA high timeout (bus idle condition)

BitField.name: TIMOUTEN
BitField.description: Clock timeout enable

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: SCL timeout detection is enabled: when SCL is low for more than tTIMEOUT (TIDLE=0) or high for more than tIDLE (TIDLE=1), a timeout error is detected (TIMEOUT=1).

BitField.name: TIMEOUTB
BitField.description: Bus timeout B This field is used to configure the cumulative clock extension timeout: In master mode, the master cumulative clock low extend time (tLOW:MEXT) is detected In slave mode, the slave cumulative clock low extend time (tLOW:SEXT) is detected tLOW:EXT= (TIMEOUTB+1) x 2048 x tI2CCLK Note: These bits can be written only when TEXTEN=0.

BitField.name: TEXTEN
BitField.description: Extended clock timeout enable

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Extended clock timeout detection is disabled

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Extended clock timeout detection is enabled. When a cumulative SCL stretch for more than tLOW:EXT is done by the I2C interface, a timeout error is detected (TIMEOUT=1).

BitField.name: ADDCODE
BitField.description: Address match code (Slave mode)

BitField.name: DIR
BitField.description: Transfer direction (Slave mode) This flag is updated when an address match event occurs (ADDR=1).

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Write transfer, slave enters receiver mode.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Read transfer, slave enters transmitter mode.

BitField.name: BUSY
BitField.description: Bus busy

BitField.name: ALERT
BitField.description: SMBus alert

BitField.name: TIMEOUT
BitField.description: Timeout or t_low detection flag

BitField.name: PECERR
BitField.description: PEC Error in reception

BitField.name: OVR
BitField.description: Overrun/Underrun (slave mode)

BitField.name: ARLO
BitField.description: Arbitration lost

BitField.name: BERR
BitField.description: Bus error

BitField.name: TCR
BitField.description: Transfer Complete Reload

BitField.name: TC
BitField.description: Transfer Complete (master mode)

BitField.name: STOPF
BitField.description: Stop detection flag

BitField.name: NACKF
BitField.description: Not acknowledge received flag

BitField.name: ADDR
BitField.description: Address matched (slave mode)

BitField.name: RXNE
BitField.description: Receive data register not empty (receivers)

BitField.name: TXIS
BitField.description: Transmit interrupt status (transmitters)

BitField.name: TXE
BitField.description: Transmit data register empty (transmitters)

BitField.name: ALERTCF
BitField.description: Alert flag clear

BitField.name: TIMOUTCF
BitField.description: Timeout detection flag clear

BitField.name: PECCF
BitField.description: PEC Error flag clear

BitField.name: OVRCF
BitField.description: Overrun/Underrun flag clear

BitField.name: ARLOCF
BitField.description: Arbitration lost flag clear

BitField.name: BERRCF
BitField.description: Bus error flag clear

BitField.name: STOPCF
BitField.description: Stop detection flag clear

BitField.name: NACKCF
BitField.description: Not Acknowledge flag clear

BitField.name: ADDRCF
BitField.description: Address Matched flag clear

BitField.name: PEC
BitField.description: Packet error checking register

BitField.name: RXDATA
BitField.description: 8-bit receive data

BitField.name: TXDATA
BitField.description: 8-bit transmit data

BitField.name: KEY
BitField.description: Key value (write only, read 0x0000)

BitField.name: PR
BitField.description: Prescaler divider These bits are write access protected see . They are written by software to select the prescaler divider feeding the counter clock. PVU bit of the must be reset in order to be able to change the prescaler divider. Note: Reading this register returns the prescaler value from the VDD voltage domain. This value may not be up to date/valid if a write operation to this register is ongoing. For this reason the value read from this register is valid only when the PVU bit in the status register (IWDG_SR) is reset.

BitField.name: RL
BitField.description: Watchdog counter reload value

BitField.name: PVU
BitField.description: Watchdog prescaler value update This bit is set by hardware to indicate that an update of the prescaler value is ongoing. It is reset by hardware when the prescaler update operation is completed in the VDD voltage domain (takes up to five LSI cycles). Prescaler value can be updated only when PVU bit is reset.

BitField.name: RVU
BitField.description: Watchdog counter reload value update This bit is set by hardware to indicate that an update of the reload value is ongoing. It is reset by hardware when the reload value update operation is completed in the VDD voltage domain (takes up to five LSI cycles). Reload value can be updated only when RVU bit is reset.

BitField.name: WVU
BitField.description: Watchdog counter window value update This bit is set by hardware to indicate that an update of the window value is ongoing. It is reset by hardware when the reload value update operation is completed in the VDD voltage domain (takes up to five LSI cycles). Window value can be updated only when WVU bit is reset.

BitField.name: WIN
BitField.description: Watchdog counter window value

BitField.name: CMPM
BitField.description: Compare match The CMPM bit is set by hardware to inform application that LPTIM_CNT register value reached the LPTIM_CMP registerâs value.

BitField.name: ARRM
BitField.description: Autoreload match ARRM is set by hardware to inform application that LPTIM_CNT registerâs value reached the LPTIM_ARR registerâs value. ARRM flag can be cleared by writing 1 to the ARRMCF bit in the LPTIM_ICR register.

BitField.name: EXTTRIG
BitField.description: External trigger edge event EXTTRIG is set by hardware to inform application that a valid edge on the selected external trigger input has occurred. If the trigger is ignored because the timer has already started, then this flag is not set. EXTTRIG flag can be cleared by writing 1 to the EXTTRIGCF bit in the LPTIM_ICR register.

BitField.name: CMPOK
BitField.description: Compare register update OK CMPOK is set by hardware to inform application that the APB bus write operation to the LPTIM_CMP register has been successfully completed.

BitField.name: ARROK
BitField.description: Autoreload register update OK ARROK is set by hardware to inform application that the APB bus write operation to the LPTIM_ARR register has been successfully completed. ARROK flag can be cleared by writing 1 to the ARROKCF bit in the LPTIM_ICR register.

BitField.name: UP
BitField.description: Counter direction change down to up In Encoder mode, UP bit is set by hardware to inform application that the counter direction has changed from down to up. UP flag can be cleared by writing 1 to the UPCF bit in the LPTIM_ICR register. Note: If the LPTIM does not support encoder mode feature, this bit is reserved. Please refer to .

BitField.name: DOWN
BitField.description: Counter direction change up to down In Encoder mode, DOWN bit is set by hardware to inform application that the counter direction has changed from up to down. DOWN flag can be cleared by writing 1 to the DOWNCF bit in the LPTIM_ICR register. Note: If the LPTIM does not support encoder mode feature, this bit is reserved. Please refer to .

BitField.name: CMPMCF
BitField.description: Compare match clear flag Writing 1 to this bit clears the CMP flag in the LPTIM_ISR register

BitField.name: ARRMCF
BitField.description: Autoreload match clear flag Writing 1 to this bit clears the ARRM flag in the LPTIM_ISR register

BitField.name: EXTTRIGCF
BitField.description: External trigger valid edge clear flag Writing 1 to this bit clears the EXTTRIG flag in the LPTIM_ISR register

BitField.name: CMPOKCF
BitField.description: Compare register update OK clear flag Writing 1 to this bit clears the CMPOK flag in the LPTIM_ISR register

BitField.name: ARROKCF
BitField.description: Autoreload register update OK clear flag Writing 1 to this bit clears the ARROK flag in the LPTIM_ISR register

BitField.name: UPCF
BitField.description: Direction change to UP clear flag Writing 1 to this bit clear the UP flag in the LPTIM_ISR register. Note: If the LPTIM does not support encoder mode feature, this bit is reserved. Please refer to .

BitField.name: DOWNCF
BitField.description: Direction change to down clear flag Writing 1 to this bit clear the DOWN flag in the LPTIM_ISR register. Note: If the LPTIM does not support encoder mode feature, this bit is reserved. Please refer to .

BitField.name: CMPMIE
BitField.description: Compare match Interrupt Enable

BitField.name: ARRMIE
BitField.description: Autoreload match Interrupt Enable

BitField.name: EXTTRIGIE
BitField.description: External trigger valid edge Interrupt Enable

BitField.name: CMPOKIE
BitField.description: Compare register update OK Interrupt Enable

BitField.name: ARROKIE
BitField.description: Autoreload register update OK Interrupt Enable

BitField.name: UPIE
BitField.description: Direction change to UP Interrupt Enable Note: If the LPTIM does not support encoder mode feature, this bit is reserved. Please refer to .

BitField.name: DOWNIE
BitField.description: Direction change to down Interrupt Enable Note: If the LPTIM does not support encoder mode feature, this bit is reserved. Please refer to .

BitField.name: CKSEL
BitField.description: Clock selector The CKSEL bit selects which clock source the LPTIM will use:

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: LPTIM is clocked by internal clock source (APB clock or any of the embedded oscillators)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: LPTIM is clocked by an external clock source through the LPTIM external Input1

BitField.name: CKPOL
BitField.description: Clock Polarity If LPTIM is clocked by an external clock source: When the LPTIM is clocked by an external clock source, CKPOL bits is used to configure the active edge or edges used by the counter: If the LPTIM is configured in Encoder mode (ENC bit is set), the encoder sub-mode 1 is active. If the LPTIM is configured in Encoder mode (ENC bit is set), the encoder sub-mode 2 is active. Refer to for more details about Encoder mode sub-modes.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: the rising edge is the active edge used for counting.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: the falling edge is the active edge used for counting

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: both edges are active edges. When both external clock signal edges are considered active ones, the LPTIM must also be clocked by an internal clock source with a frequency equal to at least four times the external clock frequency.If the LPTIM is configured in Encoder mode (ENC bit is set), the encoder sub-mode 3 is active.

BitField.name: CKFLT
BitField.description: Configurable digital filter for external clock The CKFLT value sets the number of consecutive equal samples that should be detected when a level change occurs on an external clock signal before it is considered as a valid level transition. An internal clock source must be present to use this feature

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: any external clock signal level change is considered as a valid transition

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: external clock signal level change must be stable for at least 2 clock periods before it is considered as valid transition.

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: external clock signal level change must be stable for at least 4 clock periods before it is considered as valid transition.

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: external clock signal level change must be stable for at least 8 clock periods before it is considered as valid transition.

BitField.name: TRGFLT
BitField.description: Configurable digital filter for trigger The TRGFLT value sets the number of consecutive equal samples that should be detected when a level change occurs on an internal trigger before it is considered as a valid level transition. An internal clock source must be present to use this feature

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: any trigger active level change is considered as a valid trigger

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: trigger active level change must be stable for at least 2 clock periods before it is considered as valid trigger.

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: trigger active level change must be stable for at least 4 clock periods before it is considered as valid trigger.

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: trigger active level change must be stable for at least 8 clock periods before it is considered as valid trigger.

BitField.name: PRESC
BitField.description: Clock prescaler The PRESC bits configure the prescaler division factor. It can be one among the following division factors:

BitField.name: TRIGSEL
BitField.description: Trigger selector The TRIGSEL bits select the trigger source that will serve as a trigger event for the LPTIM among the below 8 available sources: See for details.

BitField.name: TRIGEN
BitField.description: Trigger enable and polarity The TRIGEN bits controls whether the LPTIM counter is started by an external trigger or not. If the external trigger option is selected, three configurations are possible for the trigger active edge:

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: software trigger (counting start is initiated by software)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: rising edge is the active edge

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: falling edge is the active edge

BitField.name: TIMOUT
BitField.description: Timeout enable The TIMOUT bit controls the Timeout feature

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: A trigger event arriving when the timer is already started will be ignored

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: A trigger event arriving when the timer is already started will reset and restart the counter

BitField.name: WAVE
BitField.description: Waveform shape The WAVE bit controls the output shape

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Deactivate Set-once mode, PWM or One Pulse waveform depending on how the timer was started, CNTSTRT for PWM or SNGSTRT for One Pulse waveform.

BitField.name: WAVPOL
BitField.description: Waveform shape polarity The WAVEPOL bit controls the output polarity

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The LPTIM output reflects the compare results between LPTIM_CNT and LPTIM_CMP registers

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The LPTIM output reflects the inverse of the compare results between LPTIM_CNT and LPTIM_CMP registers

BitField.name: PRELOAD
BitField.description: Registers update mode The PRELOAD bit controls the LPTIM_ARR and the LPTIM_CMP registers update modality

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Registers are updated after each APB bus write access

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Registers are updated at the end of the current LPTIM period

BitField.name: COUNTMODE
BitField.description: counter mode enabled The COUNTMODE bit selects which clock source is used by the LPTIM to clock the counter:

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: the counter is incremented following each internal clock pulse

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: the counter is incremented following each valid clock pulse on the LPTIM external Input1

BitField.name: ENC
BitField.description: Encoder mode enable The ENC bit controls the Encoder mode Note: If the LPTIM does not support encoder mode feature, this bit is reserved. Please refer to .

BitField.name: ENABLE
BitField.description: LPTIM enable The ENABLE bit is set and cleared by software.

BitField.name: SNGSTRT
BitField.description: LPTIM start in Single mode This bit is set by software and cleared by hardware. In case of software start (TRIGEN[1:0] = '00â), setting this bit starts the LPTIM in single pulse mode. If the software start is disabled (TRIGEN[1:0] different than '00â), setting this bit starts the LPTIM in single pulse mode as soon as an external trigger is detected. If this bit is set when the LPTIM is in continuous counting mode, then the LPTIM will stop at the following match between LPTIM_ARR and LPTIM_CNT registers. This bit can only be set when the LPTIM is enabled. It will be automatically reset by hardware.

BitField.name: CNTSTRT
BitField.description: Timer start in Continuous mode This bit is set by software and cleared by hardware. In case of software start (TRIGEN[1:0] = '00â), setting this bit starts the LPTIM in Continuous mode. If the software start is disabled (TRIGEN[1:0] different than '00â), setting this bit starts the timer in Continuous mode as soon as an external trigger is detected. If this bit is set when a single pulse mode counting is ongoing, then the timer will not stop at the next match between the LPTIM_ARR and LPTIM_CNT registers and the LPTIM counter keeps counting in Continuous mode. This bit can be set only when the LPTIM is enabled. It will be automatically reset by hardware.

BitField.name: COUNTRST
BitField.description: Counter reset This bit is set by software and cleared by hardware. When set to '1' this bit will trigger a synchronous reset of the LPTIM_CNT counter register. Due to the synchronous nature of this reset, it only takes place after a synchronization delay of 3 LPTimer core clock cycles (LPTimer core clock may be different from APB clock). COUNTRST must never be set to '1' by software before it is already cleared to '0' by hardware. Software should consequently check that COUNTRST bit is already cleared to '0' before attempting to set it to '1'.

BitField.name: RSTARE
BitField.description: Reset after read enable This bit is set and cleared by software. When RSTARE is set to '1', any read access to LPTIM_CNT register will asynchronously reset LPTIM_CNT register content.

BitField.name: CMP
BitField.description: Compare value

BitField.name: ARR
BitField.description: Auto reload value

BitField.name: CNT
BitField.description: Counter value

BitField.name: IN1SEL
BitField.description: LPTIM input 1 selection The IN1SEL bits control the LPTIM Input 1 multiplexer, which connects LPTIM Input 1 to one of the available inputs. For connection details refer to .

BitField.name: IN2SEL
BitField.description: LPTIM input 2 selection The IN2SEL bits control the LPTIM Input 2 multiplexer, which connect LPTIM Input 2 to one of the available inputs. For connection details refer to . Note: If the LPTIM does not support encoder mode feature, these bits are reserved. Please refer to .

BitField.name: CMPM
BitField.description: Compare match The CMPM bit is set by hardware to inform application that LPTIM_CNT register value reached the LPTIM_CMP registerâs value.

BitField.name: ARRM
BitField.description: Autoreload match ARRM is set by hardware to inform application that LPTIM_CNT registerâs value reached the LPTIM_ARR registerâs value. ARRM flag can be cleared by writing 1 to the ARRMCF bit in the LPTIM_ICR register.

BitField.name: EXTTRIG
BitField.description: External trigger edge event EXTTRIG is set by hardware to inform application that a valid edge on the selected external trigger input has occurred. If the trigger is ignored because the timer has already started, then this flag is not set. EXTTRIG flag can be cleared by writing 1 to the EXTTRIGCF bit in the LPTIM_ICR register.

BitField.name: CMPOK
BitField.description: Compare register update OK CMPOK is set by hardware to inform application that the APB bus write operation to the LPTIM_CMP register has been successfully completed.

BitField.name: ARROK
BitField.description: Autoreload register update OK ARROK is set by hardware to inform application that the APB bus write operation to the LPTIM_ARR register has been successfully completed. ARROK flag can be cleared by writing 1 to the ARROKCF bit in the LPTIM_ICR register.

BitField.name: UP
BitField.description: Counter direction change down to up In Encoder mode, UP bit is set by hardware to inform application that the counter direction has changed from down to up. UP flag can be cleared by writing 1 to the UPCF bit in the LPTIM_ICR register. Note: If the LPTIM does not support encoder mode feature, this bit is reserved. Please refer to .

BitField.name: DOWN
BitField.description: Counter direction change up to down In Encoder mode, DOWN bit is set by hardware to inform application that the counter direction has changed from up to down. DOWN flag can be cleared by writing 1 to the DOWNCF bit in the LPTIM_ICR register. Note: If the LPTIM does not support encoder mode feature, this bit is reserved. Please refer to .

BitField.name: CMPMCF
BitField.description: Compare match clear flag Writing 1 to this bit clears the CMP flag in the LPTIM_ISR register

BitField.name: ARRMCF
BitField.description: Autoreload match clear flag Writing 1 to this bit clears the ARRM flag in the LPTIM_ISR register

BitField.name: EXTTRIGCF
BitField.description: External trigger valid edge clear flag Writing 1 to this bit clears the EXTTRIG flag in the LPTIM_ISR register

BitField.name: CMPOKCF
BitField.description: Compare register update OK clear flag Writing 1 to this bit clears the CMPOK flag in the LPTIM_ISR register

BitField.name: ARROKCF
BitField.description: Autoreload register update OK clear flag Writing 1 to this bit clears the ARROK flag in the LPTIM_ISR register

BitField.name: UPCF
BitField.description: Direction change to UP clear flag Writing 1 to this bit clear the UP flag in the LPTIM_ISR register. Note: If the LPTIM does not support encoder mode feature, this bit is reserved. Please refer to .

BitField.name: DOWNCF
BitField.description: Direction change to down clear flag Writing 1 to this bit clear the DOWN flag in the LPTIM_ISR register. Note: If the LPTIM does not support encoder mode feature, this bit is reserved. Please refer to .

BitField.name: CMPMIE
BitField.description: Compare match Interrupt Enable

BitField.name: ARRMIE
BitField.description: Autoreload match Interrupt Enable

BitField.name: EXTTRIGIE
BitField.description: External trigger valid edge Interrupt Enable

BitField.name: CMPOKIE
BitField.description: Compare register update OK Interrupt Enable

BitField.name: ARROKIE
BitField.description: Autoreload register update OK Interrupt Enable

BitField.name: UPIE
BitField.description: Direction change to UP Interrupt Enable Note: If the LPTIM does not support encoder mode feature, this bit is reserved. Please refer to .

BitField.name: DOWNIE
BitField.description: Direction change to down Interrupt Enable Note: If the LPTIM does not support encoder mode feature, this bit is reserved. Please refer to .

BitField.name: CKSEL
BitField.description: Clock selector The CKSEL bit selects which clock source the LPTIM will use:

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: LPTIM is clocked by internal clock source (APB clock or any of the embedded oscillators)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: LPTIM is clocked by an external clock source through the LPTIM external Input1

BitField.name: CKPOL
BitField.description: Clock Polarity If LPTIM is clocked by an external clock source: When the LPTIM is clocked by an external clock source, CKPOL bits is used to configure the active edge or edges used by the counter: If the LPTIM is configured in Encoder mode (ENC bit is set), the encoder sub-mode 1 is active. If the LPTIM is configured in Encoder mode (ENC bit is set), the encoder sub-mode 2 is active. Refer to for more details about Encoder mode sub-modes.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: the rising edge is the active edge used for counting.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: the falling edge is the active edge used for counting

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: both edges are active edges. When both external clock signal edges are considered active ones, the LPTIM must also be clocked by an internal clock source with a frequency equal to at least four times the external clock frequency.If the LPTIM is configured in Encoder mode (ENC bit is set), the encoder sub-mode 3 is active.

BitField.name: CKFLT
