BitField.name: RXONLY
BitField.description: Receive only mode enabled. This bit enables simplex communication using a single unidirectional line to receive data exclusively. Keep BIDIMODE bit clear when receive only mode is active.This bit is also useful in a multislave system in which this particular slave is not accessed, the output from the accessed slave is not corrupted. Note: This bit is not used in I2S mode.

BitField.name: CRCL
BitField.description: CRC length This bit is set and cleared by software to select the CRC length. Note: This bit should be written only when SPI is disabled (SPE = '0â) for correct operation. This bit is not used in I2S mode.

BitField.name: CRCNEXT
BitField.description: Transmit CRC next Note: This bit has to be written as soon as the last data is written in the SPI_DR register. This bit is not used in I2S mode.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Next transmit value is from Tx buffer.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Next transmit value is from Tx CRC register.

BitField.name: CRCEN
BitField.description: Hardware CRC calculation enable Note: This bit should be written only when SPI is disabled (SPE = '0â) for correct operation. This bit is not used in I2S mode.

BitField.name: BIDIOE
BitField.description: Output enable in bidirectional mode This bit combined with the BIDIMODE bit selects the direction of transfer in bidirectional mode. Note: In master mode, the MOSI pin is used and in slave mode, the MISO pin is used. This bit is not used in I2S mode.

BitField.name: BIDIMODE
BitField.description: Bidirectional data mode enable. This bit enables half-duplex communication using common single bidirectional data line. Keep RXONLY bit clear when bidirectional mode is active. Note: This bit is not used in I2S mode.

BitField.name: RXDMAEN
BitField.description: Rx buffer DMA enable When this bit is set, a DMA request is generated whenever the RXNE flag is set.

BitField.name: TXDMAEN
BitField.description: Tx buffer DMA enable When this bit is set, a DMA request is generated whenever the TXE flag is set.

BitField.name: SSOE
BitField.description: SS output enable Note: This bit is not used in I2S mode and SPI TI mode.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: SS output is disabled in master mode and the SPI interface can work in multimaster configuration

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: SS output is enabled in master mode and when the SPI interface is enabled. The SPI interface cannot work in a multimaster environment.

BitField.name: NSSP
BitField.description: NSS pulse management This bit is used in master mode only. it allows the SPI to generate an NSS pulse between two consecutive data when doing continuous transfers. In the case of a single data transfer, it forces the NSS pin high level after the transfer. It has no meaning if CPHA = â1â, or FRF = â1â. Note: 1. This bit must be written only when the SPI is disabled (SPE=0). 2. This bit is not used in I2S mode and SPI TI mode.

BitField.name: FRF
BitField.description: Frame format 1 SPI TI mode Note: This bit must be written only when the SPI is disabled (SPE=0). This bit is not used in I2S mode.

BitField.name: ERRIE
BitField.description: Error interrupt enable This bit controls the generation of an interrupt when an error condition occurs (CRCERR, OVR, MODF in SPI mode, FRE at TI mode and UDR, OVR, and FRE in I2S mode).

BitField.name: RXNEIE
BitField.description: RX buffer not empty interrupt enable

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: RXNE interrupt not masked. Used to generate an interrupt request when the RXNE flag is set.

BitField.name: TXEIE
BitField.description: Tx buffer empty interrupt enable

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: TXE interrupt not masked. Used to generate an interrupt request when the TXE flag is set.

BitField.name: DS
BitField.description: Data size These bits configure the data length for SPI transfers. If software attempts to write one of the âNot usedâ values, they are forced to the value â0111â (8-bit) Note: These bits are not used in I2S mode.

BitField.name: FRXTH
BitField.description: FIFO reception threshold This bit is used to set the threshold of the RXFIFO that triggers an RXNE event Note: This bit is not used in I2S mode.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: RXNE event is generated if the FIFO level is greater than or equal to 1/2 (16-bit)

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: RXNE event is generated if the FIFO level is greater than or equal to 1/4 (8-bit)

BitField.name: LDMA_RX
BitField.description: Last DMA transfer for reception This bit is used in data packing mode, to define if the total number of data to receive by DMA is odd or even. It has significance only if the RXDMAEN bit in the SPI_CR2 register is set and if packing mode is used (data length =< 8-bit and write access to SPI_DR is 16-bit wide). It has to be written when the SPI is disabled (SPE = 0 in the SPI_CR1 register). Note: Refer to if the CRCEN bit is set. This bit is not used in IÂ²S mode.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Number of data to transfer is even

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Number of data to transfer is odd

BitField.name: LDMA_TX
BitField.description: Last DMA transfer for transmission This bit is used in data packing mode, to define if the total number of data to transmit by DMA is odd or even. It has significance only if the TXDMAEN bit in the SPI_CR2 register is set and if packing mode is used (data length =< 8-bit and write access to SPI_DR is 16-bit wide). It has to be written when the SPI is disabled (SPE = 0 in the SPI_CR1 register). Note: Refer to if the CRCEN bit is set. This bit is not used in IÂ²S mode.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Number of data to transfer is even

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Number of data to transfer is odd

BitField.name: RXNE
BitField.description: Receive buffer not empty

BitField.name: TXE
BitField.description: Transmit buffer empty

BitField.name: CHSIDE
BitField.description: Channel side Note: This bit is not used in SPI mode. It has no significance in PCM mode.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Channel Left has to be transmitted or has been received

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Channel Right has to be transmitted or has been received

BitField.name: UDR
BitField.description: Underrun flag This flag is set by hardware and reset by a software sequence. Refer to pageÂ 1057 for the software sequence. Note: This bit is not used in SPI mode.

BitField.name: CRCERR
BitField.description: CRC error flag Note: This flag is set by hardware and cleared by software writing 0. This bit is not used in I2S mode.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: CRC value received matches the SPI_RXCRCR value

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: CRC value received does not match the SPI_RXCRCR value

BitField.name: MODF
BitField.description: Mode fault This flag is set by hardware and reset by a software sequence. Refer to (MODF) on pageÂ 1031 for the software sequence. Note: This bit is not used in I2S mode.

BitField.name: OVR
BitField.description: Overrun flag This flag is set by hardware and reset by a software sequence. Refer to pageÂ 1057 for the software sequence.

BitField.name: BSY
BitField.description: Busy flag This flag is set and cleared by hardware. Note: The BSY flag must be used with caution: refer to and .

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: SPI (or I2S) is busy in communication or Tx buffer is not empty

BitField.name: FRE
BitField.description: Frame format error This flag is used for SPI in TI slave mode and I2S slave mode. Refer to error flags and . This flag is set by hardware and reset when SPI_SR is read by software.

BitField.name: FRLVL
BitField.description: FIFO reception level These bits are set and cleared by hardware. Note: These bits are not used in IÂ²S mode and in SPI receive-only mode while CRC calculation is enabled.

BitField.name: FTLVL
BitField.description: FIFO transmission level These bits are set and cleared by hardware. Note: This bit is not used in I2S mode.

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: FIFO full (considered as FULL when the FIFO threshold is greater than 1/2)

BitField.name: DR
BitField.description: Data register Data received or to be transmitted The data register serves as an interface between the Rx and Tx FIFOs. When the data register is read, RxFIFO is accessed while the write to data register accesses TxFIFO (See ). Note: Data is always right-aligned. Unused bits are ignored when writing to the register, and read as zero when the register is read. The Rx threshold setting must always correspond with the read access currently used.

BitField.name: CRCPOLY
BitField.description: CRC polynomial register This register contains the polynomial for the CRC calculation. The CRC polynomial (0x0007) is the reset value of this register. Another polynomial can be configured as required.

BitField.name: RXCRC
BitField.description: Rx CRC register When CRC calculation is enabled, the RXCRC[15:0] bits contain the computed CRC value of the subsequently received bytes. This register is reset when the CRCEN bit in SPI_CR1 register is written to 1. The CRC is calculated serially using the polynomial programmed in the SPI_CRCPR register. Only the 8 LSB bits are considered when the CRC frame format is set to be 8-bit length (CRCL bit in the SPI_CR1 is cleared). CRC calculation is done based on any CRC8 standard. The entire 16-bits of this register are considered when a 16-bit CRC frame format is selected (CRCL bit in the SPI_CR1 register is set). CRC calculation is done based on any CRC16 standard. Note: A read to this register when the BSY Flag is set could return an incorrect value. These bits are not used in I2S mode.

BitField.name: TXCRC
BitField.description: Tx CRC register When CRC calculation is enabled, the TXCRC[7:0] bits contain the computed CRC value of the subsequently transmitted bytes. This register is reset when the CRCEN bit of SPI_CR1 is written to 1. The CRC is calculated serially using the polynomial programmed in the SPI_CRCPR register. Only the 8 LSB bits are considered when the CRC frame format is set to be 8-bit length (CRCL bit in the SPI_CR1 is cleared). CRC calculation is done based on any CRC8 standard. The entire 16-bits of this register are considered when a 16-bit CRC frame format is selected (CRCL bit in the SPI_CR1 register is set). CRC calculation is done based on any CRC16 standard. Note: A read to this register when the BSY flag is set could return an incorrect value. These bits are not used in I2S mode.

BitField.name: CHLEN
BitField.description: Channel length (number of bits per audio channel) The bit write operation has a meaning only if DATLEN = 00 otherwise the channel length is fixed to 32-bit by hardware whatever the value filled in. Note: For correct operation, this bit should be configured when the I2S is disabled. It is not used in SPI mode.

BitField.name: DATLEN
BitField.description: Data length to be transferred Note: For correct operation, these bits should be configured when the I2S is disabled. They are not used in SPI mode.

BitField.name: CKPOL
BitField.description: Inactive state clock polarity Note: For correct operation, this bit should be configured when the I2S is disabled. It is not used in SPI mode. The bit CKPOL does not affect the CK edge sensitivity used to receive or transmit the SD and WS signals.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: I2S clock inactive state is low level

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: I2S clock inactive state is high level

BitField.name: I2SSTD
BitField.description: I2S standard selection For more details on I2S standards, refer to Note: For correct operation, these bits should be configured when the I2S is disabled. They are not used in SPI mode.

BitField.name: PCMSYNC
BitField.description: PCM frame synchronization Note: This bit has a meaning only if I2SSTD = 11 (PCM standard is used). It is not used in SPI mode.

BitField.name: I2SCFG
BitField.description: I2S configuration mode Note: These bits should be configured when the I2S is disabled. They are not used in SPI mode.

BitField.name: I2SE
BitField.description: I2S enable Note: This bit is not used in SPI mode.

BitField.name: I2SMOD
BitField.description: I2S mode selection Note: This bit should be configured when the SPI is disabled.

BitField.name: ASTRTEN
BitField.description: Asynchronous start enable. When the I2S is enabled in slave mode, the hardware starts the transfer when the I2S clock is received and an appropriate transition is detected on the WS signal. When the I2S is enabled in slave mode, the hardware starts the transfer when the I2S clock is received and the appropriate level is detected on the WS signal. Note: The appropriate transition is a falling edge on WS signal when I2S Philips Standard is used, or a rising edge for other standards. The appropriate level is a low level on WS signal when I2S Philips Standard is used, or a high level for other standards. Please refer to for additional information.

BitField.name: I2SDIV
BitField.description: I2S linear prescaler I2SDIV [7:0] = 0 or I2SDIV [7:0] = 1 are forbidden values. Refer to . Note: These bits should be configured when the I2S is disabled. They are used only when the I2S is in master mode. They are not used in SPI mode.

BitField.name: ODD
BitField.description: Odd factor for the prescaler Refer to . Note: This bit should be configured when the I2S is disabled. It is used only when the I2S is in master mode. It is not used in SPI mode.

BitField.name: MCKOE
BitField.description: Master clock output enable Note: This bit should be configured when the I2S is disabled. It is used only when the I2S is in master mode. It is not used in SPI mode.

BitField.name: TAMP1E
BitField.description: Tamper detection on TAMP_IN1 enable

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Tamper detection on TAMP_IN1 is disabled.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Tamper detection on TAMP_IN1 is enabled.

BitField.name: TAMP2E
BitField.description: Tamper detection on TAMP_IN2 enable

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Tamper detection on TAMP_IN2 is disabled.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Tamper detection on TAMP_IN2 is enabled.

BitField.name: ITAMP3E
BitField.description: Internal tamper 3 enable: LSE monitoring

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Internal tamper 3 enabled: a tamper is generated when the LSE frequency is below or above thresholds.

BitField.name: ITAMP4E
BitField.description: Internal tamper 4 enable: HSE monitoring

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Internal tamper 4 enabled. a tamper is generated when the HSE frequency is below or above thresholds.

BitField.name: ITAMP5E
BitField.description: Internal tamper 5 enable: RTC calendar overflow

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Internal tamper 5 enabled: a tamper is generated when the RTC calendar reaches its maximum value, on the 31st of December 99, at 23:59:59. The calendar is then frozen and cannot overflow.

BitField.name: ITAMP6E
BitField.description: Internal tamper 6 enable: ST manufacturer readout

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Internal tamper 6 enabled: a tamper is generated in case of ST manufacturer readout.

BitField.name: TAMP1NOER
BitField.description: Tamper 1 no erase

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Tamper 1 event erases the backup registers.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Tamper 1 event does not erase the backup registers.

BitField.name: TAMP2NOER
BitField.description: Tamper 2 no erase

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Tamper 2 event erases the backup registers.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Tamper 2 event does not erase the backup registers.

BitField.name: TAMP1MSK
BitField.description: Tamper 1 mask The tamper 1 interrupt must not be enabled when TAMP1MSK is set.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Tamper 1 event generates a trigger event and TAMP1F must be cleared by software to allow next tamper event detection.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Tamper 1 event generates a trigger event. TAMP1F is masked and internally cleared by hardware. The backup registers are not erased.

BitField.name: TAMP2MSK
BitField.description: Tamper 2 mask The tamper 2 interrupt must not be enabled when TAMP2MSK is set.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Tamper 2 event generates a trigger event and TAMP2F must be cleared by software to allow next tamper event detection.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Tamper 2 event generates a trigger event. TAMP2F is masked and internally cleared by hardware. The backup registers are not erased.

BitField.name: TAMP1TRG
BitField.description: Active level for tamper 1 input (active mode disabled) If TAMPFLT = 00 Tamper 1 input rising edge and high level triggers a tamper detection event. If TAMPFLT = 00 Tamper 1 input falling edge and low level triggers a tamper detection event.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: If TAMPFLT â 00 Tamper 1 input staying low triggers a tamper detection event.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: If TAMPFLT â 00 Tamper 1 input staying high triggers a tamper detection event.

BitField.name: TAMP2TRG
BitField.description: Active level for tamper 2 input (active mode disabled) If TAMPFLT = 00 Tamper 2 input rising edge and high level triggers a tamper detection event. If TAMPFLT = 00 Tamper 2 input falling edge and low level triggers a tamper detection event.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: If TAMPFLT â 00 Tamper 2 input staying low triggers a tamper detection event.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: If TAMPFLT â 00 Tamper 2 input staying high triggers a tamper detection event.

BitField.name: TAMPFREQ
BitField.description: Tamper sampling frequency Determines the frequency at which each of the TAMP_INx inputs are sampled.

BitField.name: TAMPFLT
BitField.description: TAMP_INx filter count These bits determines the number of consecutive samples at the specified level (TAMP*TRG) needed to activate a tamper event. TAMPFLT is valid for each of the TAMP_INx inputs.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Tamper event is activated on edge of TAMP_INx input transitions to the active level (no internal pull-up on TAMP_INx input).

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Tamper event is activated after 2 consecutive samples at the active level.

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: Tamper event is activated after 4 consecutive samples at the active level.

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: Tamper event is activated after 8 consecutive samples at the active level.

BitField.name: TAMPPRCH
BitField.description: TAMP_INx precharge duration These bit determines the duration of time during which the pull-up/is activated before each sample. TAMPPRCH is valid for each of the TAMP_INx inputs.

BitField.name: TAMPPUDIS
BitField.description: TAMP_INx pull-up disable This bit determines if each of the TAMPx pins are precharged before each sample.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Precharge TAMP_INx pins before sampling (enable internal pull-up)

BitField.name: TAMP1IE
BitField.description: Tamper 1 interrupt enable

BitField.name: TAMP2IE
BitField.description: Tamper 2 interrupt enable

BitField.name: ITAMP3IE
BitField.description: Internal tamper 3 interrupt enable: LSE monitoring

BitField.name: ITAMP4IE
BitField.description: Internal tamper 4 interrupt enable: HSE monitoring

BitField.name: ITAMP5IE
BitField.description: Internal tamper 5 interrupt enable: RTC calendar overflow

BitField.name: ITAMP6IE
BitField.description: Internal tamper 6 interrupt enable: ST manufacturer readout

BitField.name: TAMP1F
BitField.description: TAMP1 detection flag This flag is set by hardware when a tamper detection event is detected on the TAMP1 input.

BitField.name: TAMP2F
BitField.description: TAMP2 detection flag This flag is set by hardware when a tamper detection event is detected on the TAMP2 input.

BitField.name: ITAMP3F
BitField.description: LSE monitoring tamper detection flag This flag is set by hardware when a tamper detection event is detected on the internal tamper 3.

BitField.name: ITAMP4F
BitField.description: HSE monitoring tamper detection flag This flag is set by hardware when a tamper detection event is detected on the internal tamper 4.

BitField.name: ITAMP5F
BitField.description: RTC calendar overflow tamper detection flag This flag is set by hardware when a tamper detection event is detected on the internal tamper 5.

BitField.name: ITAMP6F
BitField.description: ST manufacturer readout tamper detection flag This flag is set by hardware when a tamper detection event is detected on the internal tamper 6.

BitField.name: TAMP1MF
BitField.description: TAMP1 interrupt masked flag This flag is set by hardware when the tamper 1 interrupt is raised.

BitField.name: TAMP2MF
BitField.description: TAMP2 interrupt masked flag This flag is set by hardware when the tamper 2 interrupt is raised.

BitField.name: ITAMP3MF
BitField.description: LSE monitoring tamper interrupt masked flag This flag is set by hardware when the internal tamper 3 interrupt is raised.

BitField.name: ITAMP4MF
BitField.description: HSE monitoring tamper interrupt masked flag This flag is set by hardware when the internal tamper 4 interrupt is raised.

BitField.name: ITAMP5MF
BitField.description: RTC calendar overflow tamper interrupt masked flag This flag is set by hardware when the internal tamper 5 interrupt is raised.

BitField.name: ITAMP6MF
BitField.description: ST manufacturer readout tamper interrupt masked flag This flag is set by hardware when the internal tamper 6 interrupt is raised.

BitField.name: CTAMP1F
BitField.description: Clear TAMP1 detection flag Writing 1 in this bit clears the TAMP1F bit in the TAMP_SR register.

BitField.name: CTAMP2F
BitField.description: Clear TAMP2 detection flag Writing 1 in this bit clears the TAMP2F bit in the TAMP_SR register.

BitField.name: CITAMP3F
BitField.description: Clear ITAMP3 detection flag Writing 1 in this bit clears the ITAMP3F bit in the TAMP_SR register.

BitField.name: CITAMP4F
BitField.description: Clear ITAMP4 detection flag Writing 1 in this bit clears the ITAMP4F bit in the TAMP_SR register.

BitField.name: CITAMP5F
BitField.description: Clear ITAMP5 detection flag Writing 1 in this bit clears the ITAMP5F bit in the TAMP_SR register.

BitField.name: CITAMP6F
BitField.description: Clear ITAMP6 detection flag Writing 1 in this bit clears the ITAMP6F bit in the TAMP_SR register.

BitField.name: BKP
BitField.description: The application can write or read data to and from these registers. They are powered-on by VBAT when VDD is switched off, so that they are not reset by System reset, and their contents remain valid when the device operates in low-power mode. In the default configuration this register is reset on a tamper detection event. It is forced to reset value as long as there is at least one internal or external tamper flag being set. This register is also reset when the readout protection (RDP) is disabled.

BitField.name: BKP
BitField.description: The application can write or read data to and from these registers. They are powered-on by VBAT when VDD is switched off, so that they are not reset by System reset, and their contents remain valid when the device operates in low-power mode. In the default configuration this register is reset on a tamper detection event. It is forced to reset value as long as there is at least one internal or external tamper flag being set. This register is also reset when the readout protection (RDP) is disabled.

BitField.name: BKP
BitField.description: The application can write or read data to and from these registers. They are powered-on by VBAT when VDD is switched off, so that they are not reset by System reset, and their contents remain valid when the device operates in low-power mode. In the default configuration this register is reset on a tamper detection event. It is forced to reset value as long as there is at least one internal or external tamper flag being set. This register is also reset when the readout protection (RDP) is disabled.

BitField.name: BKP
BitField.description: The application can write or read data to and from these registers. They are powered-on by VBAT when VDD is switched off, so that they are not reset by System reset, and their contents remain valid when the device operates in low-power mode. In the default configuration this register is reset on a tamper detection event. It is forced to reset value as long as there is at least one internal or external tamper flag being set. This register is also reset when the readout protection (RDP) is disabled.

BitField.name: BKP
BitField.description: The application can write or read data to and from these registers. They are powered-on by VBAT when VDD is switched off, so that they are not reset by System reset, and their contents remain valid when the device operates in low-power mode. In the default configuration this register is reset on a tamper detection event. It is forced to reset value as long as there is at least one internal or external tamper flag being set. This register is also reset when the readout protection (RDP) is disabled.

BitField.name: CEN
BitField.description: Counter enable Note: External clock, gated mode and encoder mode can work only if the CEN bit has been previously set by software. However trigger mode can set the CEN bit automatically by hardware.

BitField.name: UDIS
BitField.description: Update disable This bit is set and cleared by software to enable/disable UEV event generation. Counter overflow/underflow Setting the UG bit Update generation through the slave mode controller Buffered registers are then loaded with their preload values.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: UEV enabled. The Update (UEV) event is generated by one of the following events:

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: UEV disabled. The Update event is not generated, shadow registers keep their value (ARR, PSC, CCRx). However the counter and the prescaler are reinitialized if the UG bit is set or if a hardware reset is received from the slave mode controller.

BitField.name: URS
BitField.description: Update request source This bit is set and cleared by software to select the UEV event sources. Counter overflow/underflow Setting the UG bit Update generation through the slave mode controller

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Any of the following events generate an update interrupt or DMA request if enabled. These events can be:

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Only counter overflow/underflow generates an update interrupt or DMA request if enabled.

BitField.name: OPM
BitField.description: One pulse mode

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Counter is not stopped at update event

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Counter stops counting at the next update event (clearing the bit CEN)

BitField.name: DIR
BitField.description: Direction Note: This bit is read only when the timer is configured in Center-aligned mode or Encoder mode.

BitField.name: CMS
BitField.description: Center-aligned mode selection Note: Switch from edge-aligned mode to center-aligned mode as long as the counter is enabled (CEN=1) is not allowed

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Edge-aligned mode. The counter counts up or down depending on the direction bit (DIR).

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Center-aligned mode 1. The counter counts up and down alternatively. Output compare interrupt flags of channels configured in output (CCxS=00 in TIMx_CCMRx register) are set only when the counter is counting down.

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: Center-aligned mode 2. The counter counts up and down alternatively. Output compare interrupt flags of channels configured in output (CCxS=00 in TIMx_CCMRx register) are set only when the counter is counting up.

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: Center-aligned mode 3. The counter counts up and down alternatively. Output compare interrupt flags of channels configured in output (CCxS=00 in TIMx_CCMRx register) are set both when the counter is counting up or down.

BitField.name: ARPE
BitField.description: Auto-reload preload enable

BitField.name: CKD
BitField.description: Clock division This bit-field indicates the division ratio between the timer clock (CK_INT) frequency and the dead-time and sampling clock (tDTS)used by the dead-time generators and the digital filters (ETR, TIx): Note: tDTS = 1/fDTS, tCK_INT = 1/fCK_INT.

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: Reserved, do not program this value

BitField.name: UIFREMAP
BitField.description: UIF status bit remapping

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: No remapping. UIF status bit is not copied to TIMx_CNT register bit 31.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Remapping enabled. UIF status bit is copied to TIMx_CNT register bit 31.

BitField.name: CCPC
BitField.description: Capture/compare preloaded control Note: This bit acts only on channels that have a complementary output.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: CCxE, CCxNE and OCxM bits are not preloaded

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: CCxE, CCxNE and OCxM bits are preloaded, after having been written, they are updated only when a commutation event (COM) occurs (COMG bit set or rising edge detected on TRGI, depending on the CCUS bit).

BitField.name: CCUS
BitField.description: Capture/compare control update selection Note: This bit acts only on channels that have a complementary output.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: When capture/compare control bits are preloaded (CCPC=1), they are updated by setting the COMG bit only

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: When capture/compare control bits are preloaded (CCPC=1), they are updated by setting the COMG bit or when an rising edge occurs on TRGI

BitField.name: CCDS
BitField.description: Capture/compare DMA selection

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: CCx DMA request sent when CCx event occurs

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: CCx DMA requests sent when update event occurs

BitField.name: MMS
BitField.description: Master mode selection These bits allow selected information to be sent in master mode to slave timers for synchronization (TRGO). The combination is as follows: Note: The clock of the slave timer or ADC must be enabled prior to receive events from the master timer, and must not be changed on-the-fly while triggers are received from the master timer.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Reset - the UG bit from the TIMx_EGR register is used as trigger output (TRGO). If the reset is generated by the trigger input (slave mode controller configured in reset mode) then the signal on TRGO is delayed compared to the actual reset.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Enable - the Counter Enable signal CNT_EN is used as trigger output (TRGO). It is useful to start several timers at the same time or to control a window in which a slave timer is enable. The Counter Enable signal is generated by a logic AND between CEN control bit and the trigger input when configured in gated mode. When the Counter Enable signal is controlled by the trigger input, there is a delay on TRGO, except if the master/slave mode is selected (see the MSM bit description in TIMx_SMCR register).

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: Update - The update event is selected as trigger output (TRGO). For instance a master timer can then be used as a prescaler for a slave timer.

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: Compare Pulse - The trigger output send a positive pulse when the CC1IF flag is to be set (even if it was already high), as soon as a capture or a compare match occurred. (TRGO).

Enum.name: B_0x4
Enum.description: Compare - OC1REFC signal is used as trigger output (TRGO)

Enum.name: B_0x5
Enum.description: Compare - OC2REFC signal is used as trigger output (TRGO)

Enum.name: B_0x6
Enum.description: Compare - OC3REFC signal is used as trigger output (TRGO)

Enum.name: B_0x7
Enum.description: Compare - OC4REFC signal is used as trigger output (TRGO)

BitField.name: TI1S
BitField.description: TI1 selection

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: The TIMx_CH1 pin is connected to TI1 input

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The TIMx_CH1, CH2 and CH3 pins are connected to the TI1 input (XOR combination)

BitField.name: OIS1
BitField.description: Output Idle state 1 (OC1 output) Note: This bit can not be modified as long as LOCK level 1, 2 or 3 has been programmed (LOCK bits in TIMx_BDTR register).

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: OC1=0 (after a dead-time if OC1N is implemented) when MOE=0

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: OC1=1 (after a dead-time if OC1N is implemented) when MOE=0

BitField.name: OIS1N
BitField.description: Output Idle state 1 (OC1N output) Note: This bit can not be modified as long as LOCK level 1, 2 or 3 has been programmed (LOCK bits in TIMx_BDTR register).

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: OC1N=0 after a dead-time when MOE=0

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: OC1N=1 after a dead-time when MOE=0

BitField.name: OIS2
BitField.description: Output Idle state 2 (OC2 output) Refer to OIS1 bit

BitField.name: OIS2N
BitField.description: Output Idle state 2 (OC2N output) Refer to OIS1N bit

BitField.name: OIS3
BitField.description: Output Idle state 3 (OC3 output) Refer to OIS1 bit

BitField.name: OIS3N
BitField.description: Output Idle state 3 (OC3N output) Refer to OIS1N bit

BitField.name: OIS4
BitField.description: Output Idle state 4 (OC4 output) Refer to OIS1 bit

BitField.name: OIS5
BitField.description: Output Idle state 5 (OC5 output) Refer to OIS1 bit

BitField.name: OIS6
BitField.description: Output Idle state 6 (OC6 output) Refer to OIS1 bit

BitField.name: MMS2
BitField.description: Master mode selection 2 These bits allow the information to be sent to ADC for synchronization (TRGO2) to be selected. The combination is as follows: Note: The clock of the slave timer or ADC must be enabled prior to receive events from the master timer, and must not be changed on-the-fly while triggers are received from the master timer.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Reset - the UG bit from the TIMx_EGR register is used as trigger output (TRGO2). If the reset is generated by the trigger input (slave mode controller configured in reset mode), the signal on TRGO2 is delayed compared to the actual reset.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Enable - the Counter Enable signal CNT_EN is used as trigger output (TRGO2). It is useful to start several timers at the same time or to control a window in which a slave timer is enabled. The Counter Enable signal is generated by a logic AND between the CEN control bit and the trigger input when configured in Gated mode. When the Counter Enable signal is controlled by the trigger input, there is a delay on TRGO2, except if the Master/Slave mode is selected (see the MSM bit description in TIMx_SMCR register).

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: Update - the update event is selected as trigger output (TRGO2). For instance, a master timer can then be used as a prescaler for a slave timer.

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: Compare pulse - the trigger output sends a positive pulse when the CC1IF flag is to be set (even if it was already high), as soon as a capture or compare match occurs (TRGO2).

Enum.name: B_0x4
Enum.description: Compare - OC1REFC signal is used as trigger output (TRGO2)

Enum.name: B_0x5
Enum.description: Compare - OC2REFC signal is used as trigger output (TRGO2)

Enum.name: B_0x6
Enum.description: Compare - OC3REFC signal is used as trigger output (TRGO2)

Enum.name: B_0x7
Enum.description: Compare - OC4REFC signal is used as trigger output (TRGO2)

Enum.name: B_0x8
Enum.description: Compare - OC5REFC signal is used as trigger output (TRGO2)

Enum.name: B_0x9
Enum.description: Compare - OC6REFC signal is used as trigger output (TRGO2)

Enum.name: B_0xA
Enum.description: Compare Pulse - OC4REFC rising or falling edges generate pulses on TRGO2

Enum.name: B_0xB
Enum.description: Compare Pulse - OC6REFC rising or falling edges generate pulses on TRGO2

Enum.name: B_0xC
Enum.description: Compare Pulse - OC4REFC or OC6REFC rising edges generate pulses on TRGO2

Enum.name: B_0xD
Enum.description: Compare Pulse - OC4REFC rising or OC6REFC falling edges generate pulses on TRGO2

Enum.name: B_0xE
Enum.description: Compare Pulse - OC5REFC or OC6REFC rising edges generate pulses on TRGO2

Enum.name: B_0xF
Enum.description: Compare Pulse - OC5REFC rising or OC6REFC falling edges generate pulses on TRGO2

BitField.name: SMS1
BitField.description: Slave mode selection When external signals are selected the active edge of the trigger signal (TRGI) is linked to the polarity selected on the external input (see Input Control register and Control Register description. Note: The gated mode must not be used if TI1F_ED is selected as the trigger input (TS=00100). Indeed, TI1F_ED outputs 1 pulse for each transition on TI1F, whereas the gated mode checks the level of the trigger signal. Note: The clock of the slave peripherals (timer, ADC, ...) receiving the TRGO or the TRGO2 signals must be enabled prior to receive events from the master timer, and the clock frequency (prescaler) must not be changed on-the-fly while triggers are received from the master timer.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Slave mode disabled - if CEN = '1â then the prescaler is clocked directly by the internal clock.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Encoder mode 1 - Counter counts up/down on TI1FP1 edge depending on TI2FP2 level.

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: Encoder mode 2 - Counter counts up/down on TI2FP2 edge depending on TI1FP1 level.

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: Encoder mode 3 - Counter counts up/down on both TI1FP1 and TI2FP2 edges depending on the level of the other input.

Enum.name: B_0x4
Enum.description: Reset Mode - Rising edge of the selected trigger input (TRGI) reinitializes the counter and generates an update of the registers.

Enum.name: B_0x5
Enum.description: Gated Mode - The counter clock is enabled when the trigger input (TRGI) is high. The counter stops (but is not reset) as soon as the trigger becomes low. Both start and stop of the counter are controlled.

Enum.name: B_0x6
Enum.description: Trigger Mode - The counter starts at a rising edge of the trigger TRGI (but it is not reset). Only the start of the counter is controlled.

Enum.name: B_0x7
Enum.description: External Clock Mode 1 - Rising edges of the selected trigger (TRGI) clock the counter.

Enum.name: B_0x8
Enum.description: Combined reset + trigger mode - Rising edge of the selected trigger input (TRGI) reinitializes the counter, generates an update of the registers and starts the counter.Codes above 1000: Reserved.

BitField.name: OCCS
BitField.description: OCREF clear selection This bit is used to select the OCREF clear source.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: OCREF_CLR_INT is connected to COMP1 or COMP2 output depending on TIM1_OR1.OCREF_CLR

BitField.name: TS1
BitField.description: Trigger selection This bit-field selects the trigger input to be used to synchronize the counter. Others: Reserved See for more details on ITRx meaning for each Timer. Note: These bits must be changed only when they are not used (e.g. when SMS=000) to avoid wrong edge detections at the transition.

BitField.name: MSM
BitField.description: Master/slave mode

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The effect of an event on the trigger input (TRGI) is delayed to allow a perfect synchronization between the current timer and its slaves (through TRGO). It is useful if we want to synchronize several timers on a single external event.

BitField.name: ETF
BitField.description: External trigger filter This bit-field then defines the frequency used to sample ETRP signal and the length of the digital filter applied to ETRP. The digital filter is made of an event counter in which N consecutive events are needed to validate a transition on the output:

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: No filter, sampling is done at fDTS

BitField.name: ETPS
BitField.description: External trigger prescaler External trigger signal ETRP frequency must be at most 1/4 of fCK_INT frequency. A prescaler can be enabled to reduce ETRP frequency. It is useful when inputting fast external clocks.

BitField.name: ECE
BitField.description: External clock enable This bit enables External clock mode 2. Note: Setting the ECE bit has the same effect as selecting external clock mode 1 with TRGI connected to ETRF (SMS=111 and TS=00111). It is possible to simultaneously use external clock mode 2 with the following slave modes: reset mode, gated mode and trigger mode. Nevertheless, TRGI must not be connected to ETRF in this case (TS bits must not be 00111). If external clock mode 1 and external clock mode 2 are enabled at the same time, the external clock input is ETRF.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: External clock mode 2 enabled. The counter is clocked by any active edge on the ETRF signal.

BitField.name: ETP
BitField.description: External trigger polarity This bit selects whether ETR or ETR is used for trigger operations

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: ETR is non-inverted, active at high level or rising edge.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: ETR is inverted, active at low level or falling edge.

BitField.name: SMS2
BitField.description: Slave mode selection When external signals are selected the active edge of the trigger signal (TRGI) is linked to the polarity selected on the external input (see Input Control register and Control Register description. Note: The gated mode must not be used if TI1F_ED is selected as the trigger input (TS=00100). Indeed, TI1F_ED outputs 1 pulse for each transition on TI1F, whereas the gated mode checks the level of the trigger signal. Note: The clock of the slave peripherals (timer, ADC, ...) receiving the TRGO or the TRGO2 signals must be enabled prior to receive events from the master timer, and the clock frequency (prescaler) must not be changed on-the-fly while triggers are received from the master timer.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Slave mode disabled - if CEN = '1â then the prescaler is clocked directly by the internal clock.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Encoder mode 1 - Counter counts up/down on TI1FP1 edge depending on TI2FP2 level.

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: Encoder mode 2 - Counter counts up/down on TI2FP2 edge depending on TI1FP1 level.

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: Encoder mode 3 - Counter counts up/down on both TI1FP1 and TI2FP2 edges depending on the level of the other input.

Enum.name: B_0x4
Enum.description: Reset Mode - Rising edge of the selected trigger input (TRGI) reinitializes the counter and generates an update of the registers.

Enum.name: B_0x5
Enum.description: Gated Mode - The counter clock is enabled when the trigger input (TRGI) is high. The counter stops (but is not reset) as soon as the trigger becomes low. Both start and stop of the counter are controlled.

Enum.name: B_0x6
Enum.description: Trigger Mode - The counter starts at a rising edge of the trigger TRGI (but it is not reset). Only the start of the counter is controlled.

Enum.name: B_0x7
Enum.description: External Clock Mode 1 - Rising edges of the selected trigger (TRGI) clock the counter.

Enum.name: B_0x8
Enum.description: Combined reset + trigger mode - Rising edge of the selected trigger input (TRGI) reinitializes the counter, generates an update of the registers and starts the counter.Codes above 1000: Reserved.

BitField.name: TS2
BitField.description: Trigger selection This bit-field selects the trigger input to be used to synchronize the counter. Others: Reserved See for more details on ITRx meaning for each Timer. Note: These bits must be changed only when they are not used (e.g. when SMS=000) to avoid wrong edge detections at the transition.

BitField.name: UIE
BitField.description: Update interrupt enable

BitField.name: CC1IE
BitField.description: Capture/Compare 1 interrupt enable

BitField.name: CC2IE
BitField.description: Capture/Compare 2 interrupt enable

BitField.name: CC3IE
BitField.description: Capture/Compare 3 interrupt enable

BitField.name: CC4IE
BitField.description: Capture/Compare 4 interrupt enable

BitField.name: COMIE
BitField.description: COM interrupt enable

BitField.name: TIE
BitField.description: Trigger interrupt enable

BitField.name: BIE
BitField.description: Break interrupt enable

BitField.name: UDE
BitField.description: Update DMA request enable

BitField.name: CC1DE
BitField.description: Capture/Compare 1 DMA request enable

BitField.name: CC2DE
BitField.description: Capture/Compare 2 DMA request enable

BitField.name: CC3DE
BitField.description: Capture/Compare 3 DMA request enable

BitField.name: CC4DE
BitField.description: Capture/Compare 4 DMA request enable

BitField.name: COMDE
BitField.description: COM DMA request enable

BitField.name: TDE
BitField.description: Trigger DMA request enable

BitField.name: UIF
BitField.description: Update interrupt flag This bit is set by hardware on an update event. It is cleared by software. At overflow or underflow regarding the repetition counter value (update if repetition counter = 0) and if the UDIS=0 in the TIMx_CR1 register. When CNT is reinitialized by software using the UG bit in TIMx_EGR register, if URS=0 and UDIS=0 in the TIMx_CR1 register. When CNT is reinitialized by a trigger event (refer to control register (TIM1_SMCRTIMx_SMCR)N/A), if URS=0 and UDIS=0 in the TIMx_CR1 register.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Update interrupt pending. This bit is set by hardware when the registers are updated:

BitField.name: CC1IF
BitField.description: Capture/Compare 1 interrupt flag This flag is set by hardware. It is cleared by software (input capture or output compare mode) or by reading the TIMx_CCR1 register (input capture mode only). If channel CC1 is configured as output: this flag is set when he content of the counter TIMx_CNT matches the content of the TIMx_CCR1 register. When the content of TIMx_CCR1 is greater than the content of TIMx_ARR, the CC1IF bit goes high on the counter overflow (in up-counting and up/down-counting modes) or underflow (in down-counting mode). There are 3 possible options for flag setting in center-aligned mode, refer to the CMS bits in the TIMx_CR1 register for the full description. If channel CC1 is configured as input: this bit is set when counter value has been captured in TIMx_CCR1 register (an edge has been detected on IC1, as per the edge sensitivity defined with the CC1P and CC1NP bits setting, in TIMx_CCER).

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: No compare match / No input capture occurred

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: A compare match or an input capture occurred.

BitField.name: CC2IF
BitField.description: Capture/Compare 2 interrupt flag Refer to CC1IF description

BitField.name: CC3IF
BitField.description: Capture/Compare 3 interrupt flag Refer to CC1IF description

BitField.name: CC4IF
BitField.description: Capture/Compare 4 interrupt flag Refer to CC1IF description

BitField.name: COMIF
BitField.description: COM interrupt flag This flag is set by hardware on COM event (when Capture/compare Control bits - CCxE, CCxNE, OCxM - have been updated). It is cleared by software.

BitField.name: TIF
BitField.description: Trigger interrupt flag This flag is set by hardware on the TRG trigger event (active edge detected on TRGI input when the slave mode controller is enabled in all modes but gated mode. It is set when the counter starts or stops when gated mode is selected. It is cleared by software.

BitField.name: BIF
BitField.description: Break interrupt flag This flag is set by hardware as soon as the break input goes active. It can be cleared by software if the break input is not active.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: An active level has been detected on the break input. An interrupt is generated if BIE=1 in the TIMx_DIER register.

BitField.name: B2IF
BitField.description: Break 2 interrupt flag This flag is set by hardware as soon as the break 2 input goes active. It can be cleared by software if the break 2 input is not active.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: An active level has been detected on the break 2 input. An interrupt is generated if BIE=1 in the TIMx_DIER register.

BitField.name: CC1OF
BitField.description: Capture/Compare 1 overcapture flag This flag is set by hardware only when the corresponding channel is configured in input capture mode. It is cleared by software by writing it to '0â.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The counter value has been captured in TIMx_CCR1 register while CC1IF flag was already set

BitField.name: CC2OF
BitField.description: Capture/Compare 2 overcapture flag Refer to CC1OF description

BitField.name: CC3OF
BitField.description: Capture/Compare 3 overcapture flag Refer to CC1OF description

BitField.name: CC4OF
BitField.description: Capture/Compare 4 overcapture flag Refer to CC1OF description

BitField.name: SBIF
BitField.description: System Break interrupt flag This flag is set by hardware as soon as the system break input goes active. It can be cleared by software if the system break input is not active. This flag must be reset to re-start PWM operation.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: An active level has been detected on the system break input. An interrupt is generated if BIE=1 in the TIMx_DIER register.

BitField.name: CC5IF
BitField.description: Compare 5 interrupt flag Refer to CC1IF description (Note: Channel 5 can only be configured as output)

BitField.name: CC6IF
BitField.description: Compare 6 interrupt flag Refer to CC1IF description (Note: Channel 6 can only be configured as output)

BitField.name: UG
BitField.description: Update generation This bit can be set by software, it is automatically cleared by hardware.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Reinitialize the counter and generates an update of the registers. The prescaler internal counter is also cleared (the prescaler ratio is not affected). The counter is cleared if the center-aligned mode is selected or if DIR=0 (upcounting), else it takes the auto-reload value (TIMx_ARR) if DIR=1 (downcounting).

BitField.name: CC1G
BitField.description: Capture/Compare 1 generation This bit is set by software in order to generate an event, it is automatically cleared by hardware. If channel CC1 is configured as output: CC1IF flag is set, Corresponding interrupt or DMA request is sent if enabled. If channel CC1 is configured as input: The current value of the counter is captured in TIMx_CCR1 register. The CC1IF flag is set, the corresponding interrupt or DMA request is sent if enabled. The CC1OF flag is set if the CC1IF flag was already high.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: A capture/compare event is generated on channel 1:

BitField.name: CC2G
BitField.description: Capture/Compare 2 generation Refer to CC1G description

BitField.name: CC3G
BitField.description: Capture/Compare 3 generation Refer to CC1G description

BitField.name: CC4G
BitField.description: Capture/Compare 4 generation Refer to CC1G description

BitField.name: COMG
BitField.description: Capture/Compare control update generation This bit can be set by software, it is automatically cleared by hardware Note: This bit acts only on channels having a complementary output.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: When CCPC bit is set, it allows CCxE, CCxNE and OCxM bits to be updated.

BitField.name: TG
BitField.description: Trigger generation This bit is set by software in order to generate an event, it is automatically cleared by hardware.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: The TIF flag is set in TIMx_SR register. Related interrupt or DMA transfer can occur if enabled.

BitField.name: BG
BitField.description: Break generation This bit is set by software in order to generate an event, it is automatically cleared by hardware.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: A break event is generated. MOE bit is cleared and BIF flag is set. Related interrupt or DMA transfer can occur if enabled.

BitField.name: B2G
BitField.description: Break 2 generation This bit is set by software in order to generate an event, it is automatically cleared by hardware.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: A break 2 event is generated. MOE bit is cleared and B2IF flag is set. Related interrupt can occur if enabled.

BitField.name: CC1S
BitField.description: Capture/Compare 1 selection This bit-field defines the direction of the channel (input/output) as well as the used input. Note: CC1S bits are writable only when the channel is OFF (CC1E = '0â in TIMx_CCER).

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: CC1 channel is configured as output

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: CC1 channel is configured as input, IC1 is mapped on TI1

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: CC1 channel is configured as input, IC1 is mapped on TI2

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: CC1 channel is configured as input, IC1 is mapped on TRC. This mode is working only if an internal trigger input is selected through TS bit (TIMx_SMCR register)

BitField.name: OC1FE
BitField.description: Output Compare 1 fast enable This bit decreases the latency between a trigger event and a transition on the timer output. It must be used in one-pulse mode (OPM bit set in TIMx_CR1 register), to have the output pulse starting as soon as possible after the starting trigger.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: CC1 behaves normally depending on counter and CCR1 values even when the trigger is ON. The minimum delay to activate CC1 output when an edge occurs on the trigger input is 5 clock cycles.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: An active edge on the trigger input acts like a compare match on CC1 output. Then, OC is set to the compare level independently from the result of the comparison. Delay to sample the trigger input and to activate CC1 output is reduced to 3 clock cycles. OCFE acts only if the channel is configured in PWM1 or PWM2 mode.

BitField.name: OC1PE
BitField.description: Output Compare 1 preload enable Note: These bits can not be modified as long as LOCK level 3 has been programmed (LOCK bits in TIMx_BDTR register) and CC1S=â00â (the channel is configured in output). The PWM mode can be used without validating the preload register only in one pulse mode (OPM bit set in TIMx_CR1 register). Else the behavior is not guaranteed.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Preload register on TIMx_CCR1 disabled. TIMx_CCR1 can be written at anytime, the new value is taken in account immediately.

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Preload register on TIMx_CCR1 enabled. Read/Write operations access the preload register. TIMx_CCR1 preload value is loaded in the active register at each update event.

BitField.name: OC1M1
BitField.description: Output Compare 1 mode These bits define the behavior of the output reference signal OC1REF from which OC1 and OC1N are derived. OC1REF is active high whereas OC1 and OC1N active level depends on CC1P and CC1NP bits. Note: These bits can not be modified as long as LOCK level 3 has been programmed (LOCK bits in TIMx_BDTR register) and CC1S=â00â (the channel is configured in output). Note: In PWM mode, the OCREF level changes only when the result of the comparison changes or when the output compare mode switches from âfrozenâ mode to âPWMâ mode. Note: On channels having a complementary output, this bit field is preloaded. If the CCPC bit is set in the TIMx_CR2 register then the OC1M active bits take the new value from the preloaded bits only when a COM event is generated. Note: The OC1M[3] bit is not contiguous, located in bit 16.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Frozen - The comparison between the output compare register TIMx_CCR1 and the counter TIMx_CNT has no effect on the outputs.(this mode is used to generate a timing base).

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Set channel 1 to active level on match. OC1REF signal is forced high when the counter TIMx_CNT matches the capture/compare register 1 (TIMx_CCR1).

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: Set channel 1 to inactive level on match. OC1REF signal is forced low when the counter TIMx_CNT matches the capture/compare register 1 (TIMx_CCR1).

Enum.name: B_0x4
Enum.description: Force inactive level - OC1REF is forced low.

Enum.name: B_0x5
Enum.description: Force active level - OC1REF is forced high.

Enum.name: B_0x6
Enum.description: PWM mode 1 - In upcounting, channel 1 is active as long as TIMx_CNT<TIMx_CCR1 else inactive. In downcounting, channel 1 is inactive (OC1REF='0â) as long as TIMx_CNT>TIMx_CCR1 else active (OC1REF=â1â).

Enum.name: B_0x7
Enum.description: PWM mode 2 - In upcounting, channel 1 is inactive as long as TIMx_CNT<TIMx_CCR1 else active. In downcounting, channel 1 is active as long as TIMx_CNT>TIMx_CCR1 else inactive.

Enum.name: B_0x8
Enum.description: Retrigerrable OPM mode 1 - In up-counting mode, the channel is active until a trigger event is detected (on TRGI signal). Then, a comparison is performed as in PWM mode 1 and the channels becomes active again at the next update. In down-counting mode, the channel is inactive until a trigger event is detected (on TRGI signal). Then, a comparison is performed as in PWM mode 1 and the channels becomes inactive again at the next update.

Enum.name: B_0x9
Enum.description: Retrigerrable OPM mode 2 - In up-counting mode, the channel is inactive until a trigger event is detected (on TRGI signal). Then, a comparison is performed as in PWM mode 2 and the channels becomes inactive again at the next update. In down-counting mode, the channel is active until a trigger event is detected (on TRGI signal). Then, a comparison is performed as in PWM mode 1 and the channels becomes active again at the next update.

Enum.name: B_0xC
Enum.description: Combined PWM mode 1 - OC1REF has the same behavior as in PWM mode 1. OC1REFC is the logical OR between OC1REF and OC2REF.

Enum.name: B_0xD
Enum.description: Combined PWM mode 2 - OC1REF has the same behavior as in PWM mode 2. OC1REFC is the logical AND between OC1REF and OC2REF.

Enum.name: B_0xE
Enum.description: Asymmetric PWM mode 1 - OC1REF has the same behavior as in PWM mode 1. OC1REFC outputs OC1REF when the counter is counting up, OC2REF when it is counting down.

Enum.name: B_0xF
Enum.description: Asymmetric PWM mode 2 - OC1REF has the same behavior as in PWM mode 2. OC1REFC outputs OC1REF when the counter is counting up, OC2REF when it is counting down.

BitField.name: OC1CE
BitField.description: Output Compare 1 clear enable

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: OC1Ref is not affected by the ocref_clr_int signal

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: OC1Ref is cleared as soon as a High level is detected on ocref_clr_int signal (OCREF_CLR input or ETRF input)

BitField.name: CC2S
BitField.description: Capture/Compare 2 selection This bit-field defines the direction of the channel (input/output) as well as the used input. Note: CC2S bits are writable only when the channel is OFF (CC2E = '0â in TIMx_CCER).

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: CC2 channel is configured as output

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: CC2 channel is configured as input, IC2 is mapped on TI2

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: CC2 channel is configured as input, IC2 is mapped on TI1

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: CC2 channel is configured as input, IC2 is mapped on TRC. This mode is working only if an internal trigger input is selected through the TS bit (TIMx_SMCR register)

BitField.name: OC2FE
BitField.description: Output Compare 2 fast enable Refer to OC1FE description.

BitField.name: OC2PE
BitField.description: Output Compare 2 preload enable Refer to OC1PE description.

BitField.name: OC2M1
BitField.description: Output Compare 2 mode Refer to OC1M[3:0] description.

BitField.name: OC2CE
BitField.description: Output Compare 2 clear enable Refer to OC1CE description.

BitField.name: OC1M2
BitField.description: Output Compare 1 mode These bits define the behavior of the output reference signal OC1REF from which OC1 and OC1N are derived. OC1REF is active high whereas OC1 and OC1N active level depends on CC1P and CC1NP bits. Note: These bits can not be modified as long as LOCK level 3 has been programmed (LOCK bits in TIMx_BDTR register) and CC1S=â00â (the channel is configured in output). Note: In PWM mode, the OCREF level changes only when the result of the comparison changes or when the output compare mode switches from âfrozenâ mode to âPWMâ mode. Note: On channels having a complementary output, this bit field is preloaded. If the CCPC bit is set in the TIMx_CR2 register then the OC1M active bits take the new value from the preloaded bits only when a COM event is generated. Note: The OC1M[3] bit is not contiguous, located in bit 16.

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: Frozen - The comparison between the output compare register TIMx_CCR1 and the counter TIMx_CNT has no effect on the outputs.(this mode is used to generate a timing base).

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: Set channel 1 to active level on match. OC1REF signal is forced high when the counter TIMx_CNT matches the capture/compare register 1 (TIMx_CCR1).

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: Set channel 1 to inactive level on match. OC1REF signal is forced low when the counter TIMx_CNT matches the capture/compare register 1 (TIMx_CCR1).

Enum.name: B_0x4
Enum.description: Force inactive level - OC1REF is forced low.

Enum.name: B_0x5
Enum.description: Force active level - OC1REF is forced high.

Enum.name: B_0x6
Enum.description: PWM mode 1 - In upcounting, channel 1 is active as long as TIMx_CNT<TIMx_CCR1 else inactive. In downcounting, channel 1 is inactive (OC1REF='0â) as long as TIMx_CNT>TIMx_CCR1 else active (OC1REF=â1â).

Enum.name: B_0x7
Enum.description: PWM mode 2 - In upcounting, channel 1 is inactive as long as TIMx_CNT<TIMx_CCR1 else active. In downcounting, channel 1 is active as long as TIMx_CNT>TIMx_CCR1 else inactive.

Enum.name: B_0x8
Enum.description: Retrigerrable OPM mode 1 - In up-counting mode, the channel is active until a trigger event is detected (on TRGI signal). Then, a comparison is performed as in PWM mode 1 and the channels becomes active again at the next update. In down-counting mode, the channel is inactive until a trigger event is detected (on TRGI signal). Then, a comparison is performed as in PWM mode 1 and the channels becomes inactive again at the next update.

Enum.name: B_0x9
Enum.description: Retrigerrable OPM mode 2 - In up-counting mode, the channel is inactive until a trigger event is detected (on TRGI signal). Then, a comparison is performed as in PWM mode 2 and the channels becomes inactive again at the next update. In down-counting mode, the channel is active until a trigger event is detected (on TRGI signal). Then, a comparison is performed as in PWM mode 1 and the channels becomes active again at the next update.

Enum.name: B_0xC
Enum.description: Combined PWM mode 1 - OC1REF has the same behavior as in PWM mode 1. OC1REFC is the logical OR between OC1REF and OC2REF.

Enum.name: B_0xD
Enum.description: Combined PWM mode 2 - OC1REF has the same behavior as in PWM mode 2. OC1REFC is the logical AND between OC1REF and OC2REF.

Enum.name: B_0xE
Enum.description: Asymmetric PWM mode 1 - OC1REF has the same behavior as in PWM mode 1. OC1REFC outputs OC1REF when the counter is counting up, OC2REF when it is counting down.

Enum.name: B_0xF
Enum.description: Asymmetric PWM mode 2 - OC1REF has the same behavior as in PWM mode 2. OC1REFC outputs OC1REF when the counter is counting up, OC2REF when it is counting down.

BitField.name: OC2M2
BitField.description: Output Compare 2 mode Refer to OC1M[3:0] description.

BitField.name: CC1S
BitField.description: Capture/Compare 1 Selection This bit-field defines the direction of the channel (input/output) as well as the used input. Note: CC1S bits are writable only when the channel is OFF (CC1E = '0â in TIMx_CCER).

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: CC1 channel is configured as output

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: CC1 channel is configured as input, IC1 is mapped on TI1

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: CC1 channel is configured as input, IC1 is mapped on TI2

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: CC1 channel is configured as input, IC1 is mapped on TRC. This mode is working only if an internal trigger input is selected through TS bit (TIMx_SMCR register)

BitField.name: IC1PSC
BitField.description: Input capture 1 prescaler This bit-field defines the ratio of the prescaler acting on CC1 input (IC1). The prescaler is reset as soon as CC1E=â0â (TIMx_CCER register).

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: no prescaler, capture is done each time an edge is detected on the capture input

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: capture is done once every 2 events

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: capture is done once every 4 events

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: capture is done once every 8 events

BitField.name: IC1F
BitField.description: Input capture 1 filter This bit-field defines the frequency used to sample TI1 input and the length of the digital filter applied to TI1. The digital filter is made of an event counter in which N consecutive events are needed to validate a transition on the output:

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: No filter, sampling is done at fDTS

BitField.name: CC2S
BitField.description: Capture/Compare 2 selection This bit-field defines the direction of the channel (input/output) as well as the used input. Note: CC2S bits are writable only when the channel is OFF (CC2E = '0â in TIMx_CCER).

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: CC2 channel is configured as output

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: CC2 channel is configured as input, IC2 is mapped on TI2

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: CC2 channel is configured as input, IC2 is mapped on TI1

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: CC2 channel is configured as input, IC2 is mapped on TRC. This mode is working only if an internal trigger input is selected through TS bit (TIMx_SMCR register)

BitField.name: IC2PSC
BitField.description: Input capture 2 prescaler Refer to IC1PSC[1:0] description.

BitField.name: IC2F
BitField.description: Input capture 2 filter Refer to IC1F[3:0] description.

BitField.name: CC3S
BitField.description: Capture/Compare 3 selection This bit-field defines the direction of the channel (input/output) as well as the used input. Note: CC3S bits are writable only when the channel is OFF (CC3E = '0â in TIMx_CCER).

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: CC3 channel is configured as output

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: CC3 channel is configured as input, IC3 is mapped on TI3

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: CC3 channel is configured as input, IC3 is mapped on TI4

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: CC3 channel is configured as input, IC3 is mapped on TRC. This mode is working only if an internal trigger input is selected through TS bit (TIMx_SMCR register)

BitField.name: OC3FE
BitField.description: Output compare 3 fast enable Refer to OC1FE description.

BitField.name: OC3PE
BitField.description: Output compare 3 preload enable Refer to OC1PE description.

BitField.name: OC3M1
BitField.description: Output compare 3 mode Refer to OC1M[3:0] description.

BitField.name: OC3CE
BitField.description: Output compare 3 clear enable Refer to OC1CE description.

BitField.name: CC4S
BitField.description: Capture/Compare 4 selection This bit-field defines the direction of the channel (input/output) as well as the used input. Note: CC4S bits are writable only when the channel is OFF (CC4E = '0â in TIMx_CCER).

Enum.name: B_0x0
Enum.description: CC4 channel is configured as output

Enum.name: B_0x1
Enum.description: CC4 channel is configured as input, IC4 is mapped on TI4

Enum.name: B_0x2
Enum.description: CC4 channel is configured as input, IC4 is mapped on TI3

Enum.name: B_0x3
Enum.description: CC4 channel is configured as input, IC4 is mapped on TRC. This mode is working only if an internal trigger input is selected through TS bit (TIMx_SMCR register)

BitField.name: OC4FE
BitField.description: Output compare 4 fast enable Refer to OC1FE description.

BitField.description: Output compare 4 preload enable Refer to OC1PE description.

BitField.description: Output compare 4 mode Refer to OC3M[3:0] description.
